0.title: Dad has been there on every step: Venus on 28th anniversary of her WTA debut
0.article_body: Seven-time singles Grand Slam champion Venus Williams took to Instagram Stories to share a picture on the 28th anniversary of her debut on WTA tour and wrote, "Dad [Richard] has been there every step of the way." "It's been a journey," she wrote while sharing another picture. The 42-year-old defeated Shaun Stafford 6-3, 6-4 in California on October 31, 1994.

1.title: Evidence of ancient ocean found on Mars: Study
1.article_body: Using topography maps and by analysing the layers of sediment deposited over time on Mars, researchers have found evidence of nearly a 3.5-billion-year-old shoreline. The shoreline, which was characterised by around 900 m thick sedimentary pileup, spans several thousand square kilometres, proving the existence of a massive ocean. Its water carried sediments leaving lasting marks on Mars' surface.

2.title: MDs of 5 UP discoms admit to overcharging ₹4.1 crore from consumers
2.article_body: Appearing before the UP Electricity Regulatory Commission, five distribution companies' MDs, all IAS officers, admitted that they overcharged ₹4.1 crore from consumers. They claimed that they're now refunding the overcharged amount to consumers. The Commission has asked the MDs to furnish affidavits stating the extra amount realised and refunded. All MDs will have to appear again on December 6.

3.title: Deforestation caused recent mudslide: Philippine President Marcos
3.article_body: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr on Tuesday blamed deforestation for a recent mudslide in the country which buried a mountainside community. "I noticed that in all places where the landslides came down, the mountains were bald," Marcos Jr said after an aerial inspection of the area. The landslides were triggered by Tropical Storm Nalgae.

4.title: Pant is a big batter, you're tossing him up and down like a coin: Madan Lal
4.article_body: Madan Lal said a "match-winner" like Rishabh Pant should be included in India's playing XI in T20 World Cup 2022 irrespective of Dinesh Karthik playing or not. "He's such a big batter...you're just tossing him up and down like a coin. He's bound to lose his confidence," he added. Pant hasn't been picked in India's playing XI so far.

5.title: Bilaspur jail inmate threatened to kill U'khand HC judge: Official
5.article_body: A threatening letter sent to the office of Registrar General of Uttarakhand High Court has been traced to an inmate of the Bilaspur Central Jail in Chhattisgarh, an official said on Tuesday. In the letter, which was sent a week ago, the accused demanded money. The accused threatened to murder the judge if the money wasn't sent, the official said.

6.title: Police officer breastfeeds infant separated from mother in Kerala
6.article_body: MR Ramya, a female police officer in Kerala who breastfed a 12-day-old baby separated from its mother due to a fight between its parents, has been praised by State Police Chief (SPC) and Kerala High Court's Justice Devan Ramachandran. "You are...the face of policing at its best," Justice Ramachandran said. She was also presented with a commendation certificate by SPC.

7.title: Uttar Pradesh Police gets new insignia, pic released
7.article_body: Director General of Police DS Chouhan today unveiled new insignia of Uttar Pradesh Police at its headquarters in Lucknow. From now on, police personnel of all ranks will wear it on their uniform, UP Police said in a statement. The insignia, navy blue and red in colour, will be worn atop the nameplate on the right side of the uniform.

8.title: BRS tapping our phones, paying voters ahead of Munugode bypoll: BJP
8.article_body: The BJP has complained to the Election Commission that the Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) is resorting to illegal means, including phone tapping, ahead of the Munugode bypoll in Telangana. The BJP demanded a thorough inquiry stating the methods are meant to stifle the voice of democracy. They also alleged that the BRS was transferring money to voters through mobile applications.

9.title: Congress will give India new govt under Rahul Gandhi in 2024: Kharge
9.article_body: Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge said the Congress party will give a non-BJP government to the country under the leadership of Rahul Gandhi. "In the coming 2024 elections, the Congress government will come to power at the Centre," he said. Kharge also accused PM Narendra Modi of "spreading lies" every day that could ''destroy the country'' in the long term.

10.title: Rahul Gandhi hoists national flag at Charminar in Hyderabad
10.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday hoisted the national flag at Charminar in Hyderabad. The MP also paid tribute to his father Rajiv Gandhi. The annual event was organised in commemoration of Rajiv Gandhi's visit to Charminar on October 19, 1990 to launch Sadbhavana Yatra. The ex-PM had launched the yatra for communal peace and harmony in Hyderabad and Secunderabad.

11.title: 6 injured after explosion at steel rod factory in Maharashtra
11.article_body: At least six workers were injured, including three in critical condition, after a boiler exploded at a steel rod manufacturing plant in Maharashtra's Jalna district on Tuesday, police said. The incident occurred at the Geetai Steel Company in the Maharashtra Industrial Development Corporation. Police said after the boiler exploded, hot molten iron fell on the workers.

12.title: Vivek Joshi takes charge as Financial Services Secretary
12.article_body: Senior bureaucrat Vivek Joshi on Tuesday took charge as the Secretary of the Department of Financial Services under the Ministry of Finance. Joshi assumed the role after Sanjay Malhotra was named as Revenue Secretary. Joshi, a 1989 batch IAS officer of the Haryana cadre, previously served as the Registrar General and Census Commissioner under the Ministry of Home Affairs.

13.title: What is the latest semi-final qualification scenario for T20 World Cup Super 12 Group 1?
13.article_body: Five teams in T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 Group 1 are in contention for two semi-final spots. If New Zealand, England and Australia win their final matches, it'll come down to NRR as the three teams will have seven points each. Australia would've to beat Afghanistan with big margin to advance as their NRR is worst among top three.

14.title: Guj polls delayed as PM has to inaugurate bridges like Morbi: Kharge
14.article_body: Newly elected Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge said that the Gujarat elections were delayed as PM Narendra Modi has to inaugurate more bridges like the one that fell in Morbi. Over 130 people, including women and children, were killed after a cable bridge collapsed in Morbi. After the tragedy, the assembly elections to be held in the state may be delayed.

15.title: 3 terrorists held; 10 kg bucket IED, 2 hand grenades seized in Srinagar
15.article_body: The Srinagar Police on Tuesday arrested three hybrid terrorists and seized a 10 kg improvised explosive device (IED) and two hand grenades from them. "The IED is being destroyed in situ in Rangreth area by...bomb disposal squad," Srinagar Police tweeted. A case has been registered under relevant sections of the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act, the Arms Act, and Explosives Act.

16.title: MoS Defence Ajay Bhatt visits Maharashtra NCC Directorate
16.article_body: Minister of State (MoS) for Defence Ajay Bhatt visited the Maharashtra National Cadet Corps (NCC) Directorate on Tuesday, PRO (Defence) Mumbai informed. Bhatt interacted with NCC cadets there and lauded their contribution to various patriotic and social activities, the spokesperson said. The union minister exhorted the cadets to "inculcate discipline in day-to-day life", the spokesperson added.

17.title: Policy towards China must change: German Foreign Minister
17.article_body: German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock on Tuesday said her government must form a new policy towards China. "The Chinese political system has changed massively in recent years and thus our China policy must also change," said Baerbock. The comments follow a recent political disagreement in Germany over a Chinese company acquiring a stake in the Port of Hamburg.

18.title: Kundra replies to tweet asking if marriage to Shilpa is 'staged', says 'Love is no act'
18.article_body: Raj Kundra, while answering some questions on Twitter, replied to a person who asked, "Are you & Shilpa [Shetty] still together or it's a staged act??" "Haha love this question. Love is no act and cannot be staged. 13th year anniversary on 22nd November don't forget to wish us," he responded. Kundra was arrested in a pornography-related case in 2021.

19.title: Sri Sri Ravi Shankar watches Kantara at Bengaluru ashram, Rishab shares video
19.article_body: Rishab Shetty's Kannada film 'Kantara' was recently screened for spiritual leader Sri Sri Ravi Shankar at the ashram of Art of Living in Bengaluru. In a video shared by Rishab, Sri Sri Ravi Shankar was seen praising the film. He said, "[Its] success brings...pride to Karnataka. The acting and storytelling were very enjoyable...It shows Malenadu's greatness in a beautiful way."

20.title: It'll change course of Pak film industry: Nadeem on 'The Legend...' success
20.article_body: Producer Nadeem Mandviwalla, speaking about the success of 'The Legend of Maula Jatt', said that it will change the course of the Pakistani film industry. "One film changes the course of...industry and this will happen with Maula Jatt," he added. The film, which was released in Pakistan on October 13, stars Fawad Khan, Mahira Khan and Humaima Malick.

21.title: India will qualify for T20 WC semis, hopefully final as well: Ganguly
21.article_body: Former India captain Sourav Ganguly said India will comfortably qualify for the T20 World Cup 2022 semifinals. "India only lost one match. India will qualify. Everyone is doing good...I'm hopeful that India will play finals," said the ex-BCCI President. India are currently second in Group 2 having won two out of three matches and will face Bangladesh and Zimbabwe next.

22.title: Tribal development ministry formed under Vajpayee: PM Modi
22.article_body: Targeting the Congress, and saying that previous governments didn't think about all-round development of tribal areas in the country, PM Narendra Modi said that the tribal development ministry was formed under Atal Bihari Vajpayee. "No such ministry existed before the BJP came to power. Money was spent for tribal development work after the ministry was formed," PM Modi added.

23.title: Indian Railways' earning from freight rises 17% in April-October
23.article_body: Indian Railways registered freight loading of 855.63 million tonnes (MT) during April-October 2022, marking a 9% increase from the last year's record of 786.2 MT. Further, the Railways has earned ₹92,345 crore during the period, as compared to ₹78,921 crore earning made in the same period last year. This marks an improvement of 17% in Railways earning.

24.title: Abhishek shares Aishwarya's pic from her debut film 'Iruvar' on her b'day
24.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan took to Instagram on Tuesday to wish his actress-wife Aishwarya Rai Bachchan on her birthday. Sharing a black-and-white picture of Aishwarya from her debut film 'Iruvar', he wrote, "Happy Birthday, wifey! Love, light, peace and eternal success." Several celebrities, including Esha Deol, Bipasha Basu and Riteish Deshmukh, wished Aishwarya in the comments section.

25.title: Auditioned for Randeep's part in 'Once Upon a Time in Mumbaai': Jaideep
25.article_body: Actor Jaideep Ahlawat revealed that he auditioned for 'Once Upon a Time in Mumbaai'. He auditioned for the part that Randeep Hooda ended up playing. Jaideep added he also auditioned for a role in 'Ishqiya'. When asked how he handles rejection, he said that initially, he used to feel bad but then he realised nothing can be done about it.

26.title: Rahul's form is concerning but it's good Team India is backing him: Jaffer
26.article_body: Speaking about KL Rahul, who is yet to score in double digits in ongoing T20 World Cup, Wasim Jaffer stated the India opener's form is concerning but it's good that the team is backing him. "Rahul will feel happy that...think tank of the side has backed him," he added. Earlier, Rahul Dravid said he's hoping that Rahul performs well ahead.

27.title: Pub owners in Germany to boycott telecast of Qatar World Cup
27.article_body: Some pub owners in Germany said they will not be showing Qatar World Cup matches, taking an "ethical" stand given the Gulf state's record on human rights. "Others will watch anyway but ultimately, it's my bar and my decision," said a bar owner. Another owner said the decision was not a smart decision "from an economic point of view".

28.title: T'gana CM does drama before polls but takes orders from PM Modi: Rahul
28.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday claimed PM Narendra Modi gives orders to Telangana CM and TRS leader K Chandrashekar Rao on phone. He added, "[KCR] does drama before polls but he's in direct line with PM Modi." The MP further said, "TRS...supports the BJP whenever a bill is presented in the Parliament." He claimed the two parties "work together".

29.title: AAP B-team of BJP, it emerged from RSS-backed movement: Congress
29.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh called AAP "the B-team of BJP" and alleged that it emerged from an RSS-backed movement in 2012. "India Against Corruption was a front organisation of the RSS and the AAP emerged from that", Ramesh said. He added that in terms of workers and candidates, the fight in Gujarat polls is only between Congress and BJP.

30.title: Sex racket busted in guest house in Odisha; 12 people arrested
30.article_body: A sex racket, which was being run from a private guest house in Odisha's Ganjam district, was busted by the police and 12 people were arrested. The arrested persons include customers, agents, who used to lure customers through WhatsApp messages, and the kingpin, police said. Notably, three women were rescued and several items, including 12 mobile phones, were seized.

31.title: SEBI fines 21 entities ₹1.05 crore for manipulating share price
31.article_body: SEBI has issued a cumulative fine of ₹1.05 crore on 21 entities for manipulating the share price of Sunstar Realty Development Limited (SRDL). SEBI has fined each entity ₹5 lakh and given a duration of 45 days to pay the fine. SEBI found that these entities were involved in executing manipulative trades and carrying out trades with the connected parties.

32.title: Jos Buttler became boss Buttler: Aakash on England captain's 73(47) vs NZ
32.article_body: Praising Jos Buttler for his 47-ball 73 against New Zealand in T20 World Cup 2022, Aakash Chopra said, "Jos Buttler became boss Buttler and when he plays like that, amazing things happen." He added, "I'm saying there's no T20 batter better than him in the world at the moment." The England captain was adjudged 'Player of the Match'.

33.title: Twitter discontinues ad-free articles for Blue subscribers: Report
33.article_body: Twitter will no longer allow subscribers of its Blue service to access ad-free articles, The Wall Street Journal reported citing sources. Twitter had described the ad-free feature as a way for publishers to earn more on a per-reader basis than they would from advertising. The report added that Twitter is planning to raise price of Blue to $19.99 from $4.99.

34.title: Congress is now a sinking ship: Haryana CM Khattar
34.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Tuesday said the Congress, which ruled the country for a long time, is now a sinking ship. He was campaigning for the bypoll in the Adampur assembly constituency. He also alleged that Congress was responsible for "crime, corruption and casteist politics" during its rule in the state.

35.title: Kejriwal, Mann should resign over air pollution in Delhi: BJP
35.article_body: The BJP on Tuesday said the poor quality of air in Delhi was due to the "criminal negligence" of Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann. The BJP demanded the two Aam Aadmi Party chief ministers resign for the "poison" in the air. BJP National Spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia said stubble-burning cases have increased in Punjab.

36.title: Kerala Guv advancing BJP's objectives, destabilising govt: CPI(M)
36.article_body: The CPI(M) accused Kerala Governor Arif Mohammad Khan of advancing the BJP's objectives by attempting to destabilise the state's LDF government. "The manner in which he demanded the resignation of the vice-chancellors of various universities...has no sanction of the Indian Constitution," said the party. The CPI(M) added that Khan's steps "facilitate the promotion of the Hindutva" ideology.

37.title: Cheetahs released in Kuno to be moved to a 6-km enclosure
37.article_body: The eight cheetahs moved into Kuno National Park in Madhya Pradesh from Namibia in mid-September, will be moved into a 6-km soft release enclosure, said a member of a task force set up for them. Currently, the cheetahs are living in a quarantined enclosure where they're being provided food. After 3-4 months, the cheetahs will be shifted to the wild.

38.title: Police officer slaps job aspirant who came to meet K'taka Home Minister; video surfaces
38.article_body: A Deputy Superintendent of Police (DSP) slapped a constable job aspirant in Karnataka's Tumakuru on Tuesday. The incident happened when a group of job aspirants went to meet Karnataka Home Minister Araga Jnanendra to request him to raise the upper-age limit for constable jobs. A video of the incident showed the DSP pushing through the crowd to slap the man.

39.title: Sherlyn reacts to Rakhi Sawant’s mimicry of her, calls her 'nonsense’
39.article_body: Sherlyn Chopra has reacted to Rakhi Sawant's mimicry of her. In a video posted by a media account on Instagram, Sherlyn called Rakhi "nonsense". Rakhi had mimicked Sherlyn over her statements against #MeToo accused filmmaker Sajid Khan. "Why don't you join a gym...She...doesn't want to work hard but she'll go around media and paparazzi the whole time," Sherlyn added.

40.title: Form armour around BJP to protect development: PM to Gujarat voters
40.article_body: PM Narendra Modi urged Gujarat voters to form a "Suraksha Kavach (armour)" around the BJP government to "protect the development" that is ongoing in the state. "We are hardworking, honest people...the speed at which we are able to bring progress, we cannot let anyone dent this," said PM Modi. He added that Gujarat's development "is a must" for India's development.

41.title: India hands over 200 vehicles to Nepal for use in upcoming polls
41.article_body: India on Tuesday handed over 200 vehicles to Nepal for use by various Nepali institutions during the upcoming general elections in the country, a press release by the Indian Embassy said. The vehicles were handed over at the request of the Nepalese government, the communique added. Out of the 200 vehicles, 120 are for the security forces, the embassy informed.

42.title: Most victims of Seoul's Halloween stampede were women & youngsters
42.article_body: Most victims of the Halloween stampede in Seoul last Saturday were women and youngsters, the South Korean Interior and Safety Ministry said on Tuesday. The crowd crush killed 101 women and 55 men. As many as 104 people who died were in their 20s and 12 were teenagers. Over 100,000 people were reportedly present at the time of the stampede.

43.title: Belgium, Australia are favourites to win hockey WC 2023: Ex-Dutch defender
43.article_body: Former Netherlands defender Mink van der Weerden said that Australia and Belgium are the favourites to win the upcoming FIH Men's Hockey World Cup 2023. "They (Australia-Belgium) look very strong...I hope Netherlands can lift the WC...Hockey over the past 20 years has become more and more about fitness. The young players are becoming fitter at a young age," Weerden said.

44.title: Suresh Raina joins Abu Dhabi T10 League franchise Deccan Gladiators
44.article_body: Former India player Suresh Raina has joined the Abu Dhabi T10 League franchise Deccan Gladiators. Raina will play alongside Andre Russell, Nicholas Pooran, Jason Roy, Odean Smith and Taskin Ahmed for the Gladiators. Raina announced his retirement from IPL and BCCI cricket in September and it was reported he'll play in T20 leagues in South Africa, Sri Lanka and UAE.

45.title: Confident that BJP will form govt in Himachal: Jitendra Singh
45.article_body: Union minister Jitendra Singh on Tuesday said he is 100% confident that BJP will win the upcoming Assembly polls in Himachal Pradesh and form the government again. "The kind of environment that we are seeing here, it seems that...common people have decided that BJP government should be formed once again," Singh said. "Jairam ji will be the CM," he added.

46.title: All who are trying to lose weight will identify with 'Double XL': Farah
46.article_body: Filmmaker Farah Khan reviewed Sonakshi Sinha and Huma Qureshi's film 'Double XL' after attending a special screening. Farah stated that Sonakshi and Huma were "wonderful" in the film and added that Zaheer Iqbal and Mahat Raghavendra were "very cute". "All of us who are constantly dieting or trying to lose weight or everybody...will identify with it," she added.

47.title: England's Walker & Kalvin Phillips likely to recover before World Cup: Pep Guardiola
47.article_body: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola said English footballers Kyle Walker and Kalvin Phillips are likely to recover from their injuries before the FIFA World Cup. "Kyle, I'm impressed how quick his recovery (is) but still a bit late compared to Kalvin," said Guardiola. Walker underwent groin surgery in early October, while Phillips has been sidelined due to a shoulder problem.

48.title: Russia fines Wikipedia owner $32,600 for not deleting Ukraine war entries
48.article_body: A Russian court on Tuesday fined Wikimedia Foundation, the owner of Wikipedia, 2 million roubles ($32,600) over articles relating to the Ukraine war. Stanislav Kozlovsky, head of the foundation's Russia chapter, said the penalty was imposed for not deleting entries that Russia has demanded be removed. Earlier this year, Russian authorities fined Wikimedia 5 million roubles over similar violations.

49.title: Days of 'raja-rani' are over, it's the time of common people: Shah in Himachal
49.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday criticised the Congress and said that in a democracy like India, the days of "raja-rani" are over, it is now the time of common people. Addressing a public rally in Himachal Pradesh ahead of Assembly polls, Amit Shah said, "Change this tradition of alternative governments and repeat the BJP in the state."

50.title: Govt proposes common ITR form for everyone, invites stakeholder comments
50.article_body: The Finance Ministry has proposed to introduce a common income tax return form for all taxpayers, under which income from virtual digital assets will have to be disclosed under a separate head. The Central Board of Direct Taxes has invited stakeholder comments on the form by December 15. All taxpayers, except trusts and non-profit organisations, can use the proposed form.

51.title: Star Sports urges fans to believe in blue as India look to end the wait
51.article_body: The Indian Cricket Team looks to return to winning ways against Bangladesh in the upcoming match as it aims to secure a berth in the semi-finals of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2022. Sports-lovers can tune in to watch the action LIVE on Star Sports & Disney+ Hotstar on Wednesday, November 2, 1 PM onwards.

52.title: Atmosphere was incredible: Ex-Dutch player recalls 2018 WC QF against India
52.article_body: Ex-Netherlands defender Mink van der Weerden recalled the 2018 FIH Men's Hockey World Cup quarter-final match against India which was played at Bhubaneswar's Kalinga Stadium. "The whole atmosphere was incredible...They were the most special circumstances I have ever played a game in...It was a full crowd that day and the home fans were loudly cheering for India," Weerden said.

53.title: Ex-Chief Secy Narain tampered with evidence: Andaman admin to SC
53.article_body: The Andaman and Nicobar Islands administration has told the Supreme Court (SC) that it has proof its former Chief Secretary Jitendra Narain, who is accused of gangrape and sexual abuse, "tampered with the evidence". Narain had directed the private operator of CCTV cameras to remove them, it said. Further, the Union Territory's administration challenged the anticipatory bail given to Narain.

54.title: Italy PM vows to tighten laws after illegal rave busted in Modena
54.article_body: Italian PM Giorgia Meloni vowed to tighten laws against unauthorised parties after police busted a rave in the city of Modena on Monday, which, according to residents, had been going on for two straight days. Police reportedly arrested 14 organisers of the illegal rave and confiscated audio equipment worth €150,000 (₹1,22,31,767). The party was purportedly organised in an abandoned warehouse.

55.title: Puneeth Rajkumar posthumously awarded Karnataka Ratna
55.article_body: Late Kannada actor Puneeth Rajkumar was posthumously awarded Karnataka Ratna at an event held in Bengaluru on Tuesday. The event was attended by Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai and actors Rajinikanth and Jr NTR. The award was received by Puneeth's wife. Several people attended the award ceremony amid heavy rainfall.

56.title: Odisha court sentences man to 20 yrs in jail for raping a minor, who's now his wife
56.article_body: A 25-year-old man, who married the girl he was accused of raping when she was a minor, was sentenced to 20 years in jail by a fast-track court in Odisha's Angul district. Last year, he married her after she turned 18. The judge, however, sentenced him, saying that such offences leave an indelible mark on the mind of the child.

57.title: Got into music after getting fired from job in New York: Prateek Kuhad
57.article_body: Singer Prateek Kuhad revealed he got into music after getting fired from a consulting firm in New York. "I got fired from my job...I was wondering what I could do now...I decided to take a year off and try this (music) out. I never liked doing that (job) anyway," he added. Prateek said he was "very frustrated" with the job.

58.title: T20 World Cup is a ruthless tournament: England captain Buttler
58.article_body: After England won their second match of T20 World Cup 2022 against New Zealand, England captain Jos Buttler said, "It's a ruthless tournament, last year South Africa went out despite having four wins out of five games." He added that his side had the confidence that showed up today and they didn't think too much about the past "poor performance".

59.title: PM Modi to inaugurate over 3,000 flats in Delhi tomorrow
59.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will inaugurate 3,024 flats for economically weaker sections (EWS) at Kalkaji in South Delhi on Wednesday. He will hand over the keys to some of the beneficiaries of the in-situ slum rehabilitation project, a statement from Prime Minister's Office said. The flats have been built at a cost of ₹345 crore.

60.title: 8-ft-long crocodile enters house at night in UP in search of food, pic surfaces
60.article_body: A family in UP's Etawah woke up to find an eight-foot-long crocodile in their house. The home's owner said it entered the house at night in search of food when they were sleeping. They called police who told them to lock the reptile inside the house. They stayed awake throughout the night and the rescue operation started in the morning.

61.title: Rohith Vemula symbol of struggle against injustice: Rahul Gandhi
61.article_body: After he was joined by Radhika Vemula, Rohith Vemula's mother, in the morning leg of the Bharat Jodo Yatra, Rahul Gandhi said that Vemula is and will remain the symbol of his struggle against social discrimination and injustice. Rohith, a Dalit student, died by suicide in 2016 following alleged harassment. "By meeting Rohith's mother...the journey gained new courage", Rahul said.

62.title: India to overtake Germany as 4th largest economy by FY26: RBI Dy Guv
62.article_body: During an event, Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Deputy Governor Michael Patra said that India will overtake Germany to become the world's fourth-largest economy by 2025-26. By 2027, India will overtake Japan and become the third-largest economy, he said. "India's population will become the largest in the world next year...It'll demand the world's best financial intermediation services," he added.

63.title: I've got lot of experience, happy to help in any way I can: Smith
63.article_body: After not being played so far in the T20 World Cup, Australian batter Steve Smith said that he has a lot of experience and is happy to help in any way possible. "If you have got someone who is able to bat through...and let the hitters go around them, that has worked pretty well...I can play that role," Smith said.

64.title: Uber's Q3 revenue rises 72%, adjusted earnings hit record $516 million
64.article_body: Uber Technologies on Tuesday said its revenue for the July-September quarter was $8.34 billion, up 72% from last year. Meanwhile, the company's adjusted earnings hit record $516 million in Q3 and gross bookings also grew 26% to $29.12 billion. "Even as the macroeconomic environment remains uncertain, Uber's core business is stronger than ever," said Uber CEO Dara Khosrowshahi.

65.title: SC rejects plea to put candidates' age, education on ballots & EVMs
65.article_body: The Supreme Court declined to hear a plea directing the Election Commission to replace party symbols on ballots and electronic voting machines (EVMs) with age, educational qualifications and photographs of candidates. The petition, filed by advocate Ashwini Upadhyay, said this will help voters elect honest candidates and "control the dictatorship of political party bosses in ticket distribution".

66.title: I agreed to do 'Bhediya' after hearing just the one-line idea: Varun Dhawan
66.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan revealed he agreed to feature in 'Bhediya' after hearing the one-line idea. He added that he was in constant touch with producers as he didn't want to let go of 'Bhediya'. "My biggest dream as an actor is to entertain through a diverse array of roles. 'Bhediya' is the most important addition to that endeavour," he added.

67.title: Rohit was maybe not able to use his resources: Zaheer on India's loss vs SA
67.article_body: Zaheer Khan said that Rohit Sharma-led India got their T20 World Cup 2022 match against South Africa to that level from where they had to just finish it and they lost. He added, "10 overs and 94 to get. You created panic in...South African side...It felt like...to a certain degree that Rohit was maybe not able to use his resources."

68.title: SpaceX launches Falcon Heavy rocket after 3-year hiatus
68.article_body: SpaceX's Falcon Heavy was launched from the Kennedy Space Centre in Florida, for the first time in over three years. The mission, called USSF 44, included a rocket system having three Falcon 9 boosters strapped side-by-side with two US Space Force satellites. The Space Force asked SpaceX to end the launch live stream early and not show their deployment.

69.title: Conman's ₹10 cr claim attempt to divert attention from Morbi: Kejriwal
69.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said allegations that conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar paid ₹10 crore to AAP’s Satyendra Jain as “protection money” is an attempt to divert attention from the Morbi incident. "Before Punjab polls, they came out with Kumar Vishwas. Now, the BJP...has produced Sukesh,'' said Kejriwal. Chandrashekhar has reportedly claimed the same in a letter to Delhi LG VK Saxena.

70.title: Projects must respect sovereignty: Jaishankar at SCO meet hosted by China
70.article_body: Connectivity projects should respect the sovereignty and territorial integrity of member states of the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO), External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said at a virtual meeting of SCO Council of Heads of Government. "Fair market access is to our mutual benefit and only way to move forward," he added. The meeting was hosted by Chinese Premier Li Keqiang.

71.title: Shocked to know of Gujarat bridge collapse, extend deep condolences: Chinese Prez
71.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping has said he was "shocked" to learn about the deadly bridge collapse in Gujarat's Morbi that killed 135 people and injured over 100 others. "On behalf of the Chinese government and...people, I would like to express our deep condolences to the victims and extend our sincere sympathy to their families and the injured," he said.

72.title: Hurt by media trial: Raj Kundra on why he hides his face behind masks
72.article_body: Taking to Twitter, Raj Kundra wrote that he wears face masks for the media. "[I] don't wish to give the media a chance to click my face! I'm hurt by the media trial they put me through," he further tweeted. Raj was arrested in July 2021 in connection with the alleged creation and uploading of porn films on apps.

73.title: Develop techniques to conserve water resources: Prez to scientists
73.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu appealed to scientists, town planners and innovators to develop water resource conservation techniques. "There will be a need to effectively conserve water to meet the demands of our future generation and technology will play an important role," she said. Jal Shakti Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat also said there is a need for a holistic approach to conservation.

74.title: Police shoots man after he drives through barricaded area in Omaha
74.article_body: A man was shot and wounded by a police officer on Monday night after the former recklessly drove his car through a barricaded area during a Halloween party in US' Omaha, police said. The driver's name has not yet been released. Police say no one else was injured in the incident that took place in Omaha's Minne Lusa neighbourhood.

75.title: Siddhant Chaturvedi dresses as Shaktimaan for Halloween, shares video
75.article_body: Actor Siddhant Chaturvedi took to Instagram and shared a video of himself dressed as Pandit Gangadhar Shastri transforming into Shaktimaan for Halloween. In the video, Sidharth also revealed that he tore off the pants of his Shaktimaan costume. Along with the video, Siddhant wrote, "Sorry Shaktimaan." The actor recently featured in 'Gehraiyaan'.

76.title: Modi govt moving towards 'licence raj': Cong's Prithviraj Chavan
76.article_body: Congress leader and former Maharashtra CM Prithviraj Chavan criticised the Narendra Modi-led Centre over the issue of several major investments going to the state of Gujarat. "The way...Modi government is behaving it seems they are moving towards licence raj...which the Congress had brought to an end in the past," Chavan said. "It's not good for the country," he added.

77.title: Discussions on global spillovers one of the G20 priorities: FM Sitharaman
77.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that discussions on global spillovers will be one of the priorities on the agenda of India's upcoming G20 presidency. Sitharaman added, "How much can India and low- and middle-income countries bear the brunt of spillovers and how can you be ready for unpredictable spillovers?" India will be handed over G20 presidency in December from Indonesia.

78.title: AAP releases eighth list of 22 candidates for Gujarat Assembly polls
78.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Tuesday released its eighth list of 22 candidates for the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections. It has nominated youth leader Yuvrajsinh Jadeja from Dahegam and Koli leader Raju Solanki, who joined the AAP last week, from Bhavnagar West. The AAP is the only party that has declared over 100 candidates for the elections so far.

79.title: Twitter's Chief Customer Officer Sarah resigns after Musk's takeover
79.article_body: Twitter's Chief Customer Officer Sarah Personette, who joined the company in 2018, resigned shortly after Elon Musk's Twitter takeover. "I wanted to share that I resigned on Friday from Twitter and my work access was officially cut off last night," Sarah tweeted. Earlier last week, Business Insider reported that she would get $11.2 million in payout.

80.title: Foodtech unicorn Rebel Foods raises ₹100 cr in debt funding
80.article_body: Foodtech unicorn Rebel Foods raised ₹100 crore in a debt funding round from InnoVen Capital and Trifecta Capital. The board of Rebel Foods also passed a resolution to issue 10,000 Series E non-convertible debentures at an issue price of ₹1,00,000 per share to raise ₹100 crore. So far, the Sequoia-backed startup has raised $536.5 million in funding.

81.title: Prez Murmu to visit Nagaland on Nov 2,3; to inaugurate schools, roads
81.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu will embark on a two-day visit to Nagaland on November 2 and 3, officials said. On her maiden visit to Nagaland after assuming office, President Murmu will virtually inaugurate newly constructed government schools, Pradhan Mantri Gram Sadak Yojana (PMGSY) roads and Kohima Super Market. She is also scheduled to meet state ministers at Raj Bhavan in Kohima.

82.title: BJP, TRS workers clash on last day of Munugode bypoll campaign
82.article_body: A clash broke out between workers of Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) and BJP on the last day of the Munugode bypoll campaign on Tuesday. TRS MLC P Rajeshwar Reddy and MLA Peddi Sudarshan Reddy were among those injured in the incident. BJP state president Bandi Sanjay Kumar alleged that TRS is "unable to bear the massive response" received by BJP.

83.title: Heavy rainfall, thunderstorm warning issued for several states for next few days
83.article_body: The IMD, in its latest bulletin, issued heavy rainfall warning for states/UTs including Kerala, Tamil Nadu and Puducherry from November 2 to 5. It stated thunderstorm accompanied with lightning is very likely over Kerala, Tamil Nadu and Puducherry from November 2 and 5. Thunderstorm accompanied with lightning is likely over Andhra Pradesh on November 2 and 3, it added.

84.title: Don't use my photos in Bharat Jodo Yatra publicity material: Digvijaya to Congress
84.article_body: Senior Congress leader Digvijaya Singh requested Congress' Madhya Pradesh unit to not use his photographs in the publicity material for Bharat Jodo Yatra. He said photos of former Congress Presidents Sonia and Rahul Gandhi, present party chief Mallikarjun Kharge and Kamal Nath should be used. State Congress spokesperson Narendra Saluja said Singh has been against publishing his photos for long.

85.title: Nearly 100 teaching job aspirants detained for blocking Kolkata road
85.article_body: Nearly 100 teaching job aspirants demanding appointment in schools were detained in Kolkata's Salt Lake area on Tuesday for blocking a road without informing authorities, a police officer said. The protestors claimed to have been deprived of teaching jobs despite having qualified in the recruitment tests conducted by the West Bengal School Service Commission.

86.title: 17-yr-old murdered by two men for not sharing WiFi hotspot password in Maha
86.article_body: A 17-year-old boy was murdered by two men for not giving them the WiFi hotspot password in the Kamothe area in Maharashtra's Navi Mumbai. "The two accused stabbed the victim after a fight broke out between them," said Vivek Pansare, DCP Zone-1, Navi Mumbai. Police said the two men were under the influence of alcohol when they committed the crime.

87.title: Was ousted from a film just before taking flight to shoot location: Anchal
87.article_body: Actress Anchal Singh, known for shows 'Yeh Kaali Kaali Ankhein' and 'Undekhi', revealed that she was once ousted from a film just before taking a flight to shoot location. Adding that she "felt awful", Anchal said, "It took time...to overcome that loss." Anchal further said now she's in a place where she feels secure when it comes to getting work.

88.title: Show me instance where BJP fought in favour of OBC reservation: Siddaramaiah
88.article_body: Speaking to reporters in Bengaluru, Congress leader Siddaramaiah asked them to show one instance where BJP has fought in favour of reservation for backward classes since Independence. The former Karnataka CM accused the BJP of being "anti-reservation". He also said that the centre's decision regarding the 10% reservation for the Economically Weaker Section was not in line with the Constitution.

89.title: Actor Anshuman Jha ties the knot with athlete Sierra Winters, shares pics
89.article_body: Actor Anshuman Jha, who has appeared in films like 'LSD: Love, Sex Aur Dhokha' and 'Pari', tied the knot with athlete Sierra Winters on October 29. The wedding took place in North Carolina, USA. Anshuman also shared pictures from his wedding on his Instagram handle. In an interview, he said, "I always wanted to find a partner who inspires me."

90.title: Tech Mahindra's attrition rate drops to 20%, hires 5,877 people in Q2
90.article_body: Tech Mahindra reported a decline in its attrition rate to 20% during the July-September quarter from 22% reported in the first quarter ended June 30, 2022. The company added 5,877 new hires in Q2, taking its total headcount to 1,63,912. "[We] believe that we need to manage headcount with...view to build future," Tech Mahindra CEO and MD CP Gurnani said.

91.title: 40 pistols & 36 magazines seized from car in MP, accused absconding
91.article_body: A cache of illegal weapons, including 40 pistols and 36 magazines, was seized from a car after a long chase by the police in Madhya Pradesh's Khargone district, Police Commissioner Harinarayanachari Mishra said on Tuesday. In a bid to avoid police, the driver increased the speed of the car and while escaping, hit a police vehicle, Mishra added.

92.title: Actress Kangana Ranaut is welcome to join BJP: JP Nadda
92.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda has stated that actress Kangana Ranaut is welcome to join the party. He added, "But as far as contesting the polls is concerned, it is not my decision alone...Everyone is welcome to join the BJP. But in what capacity, the party decides." Ranaut recently said she is willing to fight elections from Himachal Pradesh's Mandi.

93.title: Make double engine govt again & we'll make Himachal drug-free: Shah
93.article_body: Addressing a public rally in poll-bound Himachal Pradesh, Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday said, "Make double engine government (BJP) again and we will make Himachal Pradesh drug-free." Notably, voting for the Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections will take place on November 12. The counting of votes will take place on December 8.

94.title: Credit to the way England played: NZ skipper Williamson after loss
94.article_body: After losing to England by 20 runs on Tuesday, New Zealand skipper Kane Williamson said that credit goes to their opponent for the way they played. "England put us under pressure. They played beautifully...they were clinical. It was a slightly above-par total. We tried to take it a little deep, but credit to the way they bowled," Williamson said.

95.title: Not the CEO you're looking for: Banker Parag as profile visits rise 36% after Twitter CEO's firing
95.article_body: After Parag Agrawal was fired as Twitter CEO, a banker with the same name as his, shared a screenshot showing a 36% surge in his LinkedIn profile visits. Sharing the data, he wrote, "To help folks with finding the right Parag, I've changed my profile page headline." Agrawal then updated his bio to, "Not the CEO you are looking for."

96.title: Bus carrying 35 passengers catches fire in Maharashtra, none hurt
96.article_body: A Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC) bus carrying 35 passengers caught fire in the Pimpalvihir area on Amravati-Nagpur National Highway on Tuesday. As per reports, the bus driver spotted the fire and alarmed the passengers, who quickly got off the vehicle. Traffic on the highway came to a halt for almost an hour.

97.title: Ram Charan's film with 'Jersey' director Gowtam Tinnanuri shelved
97.article_body: Actor Ram Charan's publicist has confirmed that the actor's upcoming film with 'Jersey' director Gowtam Tinnanuri has been shelved. The film was tentatively named 'RC 16'. "Ram's new project announcement will be [unveiled] officially very soon, whatever the combo is, it will be lit," the actor's publicist tweeted. Ram is currently shooting for a project with filmmaker Shankar.

98.title: Crypto regulation a working priority in G20 Presidency: Sitharaman
98.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said framing crypto assets will be one of eight priorities that are still in the works for India's G20 Presidency. "I know work has been done by Financial Stability Board (FSB), OECD, IMF and the Bank for International Settlements (BIS)," she said. "So we will have to bring all of them together [for conversations]," she added.

99.title: New species of owl with unique call discovered in Africa
99.article_body: A new species of owl has been discovered in Príncipe, an island on the African west coast. The bird, called the Principe Scops-Owl, was first located by scientists in 2016, but suspicions of its existence started back in 1998. The bird has unique call of a short "tuu" note that repeats at a rate of about one note per second.

100.title: No moral conflict in buying Russian oil: Hardeep Singh Puri
100.article_body: Union Minister for Petroleum and Natural Gas Hardeep Singh Puri said there was no moral conflict in buying Russian oil. Puri, in an interview, said the government has a moral duty to ensure that consumers are supplied with energy. Puri also said India will examine the prospect of a price cap on Russian oil, proposed by the G7 countries.

101.title: Virat Kohli coaches forward-press to KL Rahul ahead of Bangladesh match, video surfaces
101.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing Virat Kohli coaching forward-press to KL Rahul ahead of India's T20 World Cup 2022 match against Bangladesh. In the video, Kohli can be seen having a word with batting coach Vikram Rathour before advising Rahul. Rahul has scored 22 runs in three innings in the ongoing T20 World Cup 2022.

102.title: Insurtech platform Cover Genius raises $70 mn in Series D round
102.article_body: Insurtech platform Cover Genius, which offers embedded insurance, raised $70 million in its Series D funding round led by Dawn Capital. Existing investors GSquared and King River Capital, along with Atlas Merchant Capital also participated in the round. Authorised in nearly 60 countries, Cover Genius offers personalised insurance and warranty products along with instant claim payments.

103.title: Flipkart India's FY22 net loss increases to ₹3,413 crore
103.article_body: Flipkart India's consolidated net loss in the financial year 2021-22 increased to ₹3,413 crore, according to financial data accessed by business intelligence platform Tofler. However, Flipkart saw net total income both on a standalone and consolidated basis increase by about 18% to ₹51,175.7 crore. Flipkart's net loss on a standalone basis grew to ₹3,404.3 crore during the financial year.

104.title: RBI facilitates govt securities trading via digital rupee: Reports
104.article_body: The RBI has provided the Negotiated Dealing System-Order Matching (NDS-OM) platform to nine banks to trade in government securities using the central bank's digital currency as a pilot project, reports said. Transactions on the platform are settled instantly, reports added. "Over ₹100 crore of transactions had taken place by 12 pm on this platform," a source told Moneycontrol.

105.title: Goa bans drinking in public & other activities, warns of fines of up to ₹50,000
105.article_body: Goa Tourism Department has banned several activities like driving vehicles on beaches, unauthorised hawking, touting, begging and drinking in tourist places, in a bid to refine tourism. Listing these activities as "nuisance", the state government stated that either an action under the Indian Penal Code or a fine of ₹5,000 to ₹50,000 would be imposed on the violators.

106.title: World's largest iPhone factory worker walks 40 km to escape China's Covid lockdown
106.article_body: Dong Wanwan, a 20-year-old working at the world's largest iPhone factory run by Apple's supplier Foxconn in Zhengzhou, walked 40 kilometres to escape China's COVID-19 lockdown. The factory went into a "closed loop" after COVID-19 began spreading at the campus, Bloomberg reported. "Foxconn really messed up, I don't think a lot of people would want to go back," Wanwan said.

107.title: Tourists drive car on cable bridge in Karnataka, locals force them back; video surfaces
107.article_body: Days after over 130 people died in Morbi cable bridge collapse in Gujarat, a video of tourists driving a car on Shivapura hanging bridge in Karnataka has surfaced online. The video shows locals ensuring that the car is driven back from the bridge in reverse gear. The locals said the tourists were from Maharashtra.

108.title: Thank you for existing you crazy human being: Hrithik on Saba's b'day
108.article_body: Actor Hrithik Roshan took to Instagram and wished his rumoured girlfriend and actress Saba Azad on her birthday. Along with her photo, the 'Vikram Vedha' actor wrote, "Thank you for existing you quirky crazy nutty anomaly of a human being." Saba had recently featured in the web series 'Rocket Boys', which also starred Jim Sarbh.

109.title: We found some consistency today: SL captain Shanaka on win vs Afghanistan
109.article_body: Sri Lanka captain Dasun Shanaka said his side found some consistency in their six-wicket win against Afghanistan in T20 World Cup Super 12 stage match on Tuesday. "We're aiming to win our next game with a healthy run-rate which gives us a good chance to qualify [for semi-final]," he added. Sri Lanka are currently placed fourth in Group 1.

110.title: India have to be there: Mithali Raj predicts her finalists for T20 WC 2022
110.article_body: Ex-India Women captain Mithali Raj has picked her T20 World Cup 2022 finalists, saying, "India have to be there and New Zealand." She added, "My predictions for semi-final spot...will be India and South Africa from Group 2. From Group 1, it'll be New Zealand and a toss-up between England and Australia." India are currently second in Group 2 standings.

111.title: Pacers bowled too full, erred with our lines and lengths: Nabi on loss to SL
111.article_body: After losing to Sri Lanka on Tuesday and getting knocked out of the T20 World Cup, Afghanistan skipper Mohammad Nabi said that their pacers bowled "too full". "We erred with our lines and lengths. We gave away too many opportunities for them to hit...We got a good start in the powerplay. We didn't keep the momentum going," Nabi said.

112.title: Tulja Bhavani temple in Maha's Osmanabad to undergo renovation
112.article_body: The premises of Tulja Bhavani temple in Maharashtra's Osmanabad will be revamped and the sanctum will be inlaid with gold and silver, a district official said. A detailed project report for revamping the temple will be made in three months, District Collector Sachin Ombase said. Work will be carried out after considering disaster management principles to prevent overcrowding, he added.

113.title: US Senator calls for probe into Saudi firm's stake in Twitter
113.article_body: US Democratic Party Senator Chris Murphy on Monday called for a national security review of Saudi Arabia's Kingdom Holding Company's stake in Twitter Inc following Elon Musk's takeover of the social media company. Murphy said he was asking the Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States (CFIUS) to investigate "the national security implications of Saudi Arabia's purchase of Twitter".

114.title: I will break your legs: SFI leader tells Kerala college principal
114.article_body: A member of the Students' Federation of India (SFI), the student's wing of the CPI(M), along with his friends stormed into the office of a college principal in Kerala's Thrissur and issued him death threats. "If you continue to show hooliganism against the students here, I will break your legs," the leader was purportedly heard saying in a video.

115.title: Kapil Dev to make special appearance in Sonakshi, Huma's 'Double XL': Reports
115.article_body: Ex-India captain Kapil Dev will reportedly make a special appearance in 'Double XL', an upcoming film starring Sonakshi Sinha and Huma Qureshi. "He isn't featured as one of the cast members. Instead, the legendary veteran cricketer will be seen playing himself," a source was quoted as saying. Cricketer Shikhar Dhawan will also make his Bollywood debut with 'Double XL'.

116.title: Wishing a very happy birthday to a legend: Yuvraj to VVS Laxman
116.article_body: Yuvraj Singh took to Twitter on VVS Laxman's 48th birthday and wrote, "Wishing a very happy birthday to a legend who showcased flawless class...character on the pitch and off it too! Have a good one Laxi." Mithali Raj tweeted, "Happy Birthday, Laxman. One of the finest batters to play for India and one who stood tall in adverse situations for...team."

117.title: Millions of microplastics come off Teflon-coated pans during cooking: Study
117.article_body: According to a study, thousands to millions of ultrasmall plastic particles are released into food while cooking in a Teflon-coated non-stick pan. Just a single small crack on the surface of such a pan can release about 9,100 plastic particles, the study stated. Teflon is the brand name of Polytetrafluoroethylene, a kind of PFAS that has several health risks.

118.title: L-G Saxena forms panel to boost Delhi's night-time economy
118.article_body: Lieutenant Governor (L-G) VK Saxena has formed a committee to ease the process to issue licences to restaurants and hotels, in a bid to give impetus to Delhi's night-time economy. "The L-G has directed the committee to submit its report/recommendations in 15 days," said the L-G house. The move follows a recent decision to allow 314 establishments to operate 24X7.

119.title: Detailed inquiry into Morbi bridge collapse is need of hour: PM Modi
119.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said a detailed and extensive inquiry to identify all aspects relating to the Morbi bridge collapse is the need of the hour. He chaired a high-level meeting to review the situation. PM Modi added that key learnings from the inquiry must be implemented at the earliest.

120.title: 4 mn vehicles renewed PUC papers in last 10 months in Delhi: Report
120.article_body: The owners of about 4 million vehicles in Delhi renewed their Pollution Under Control (PUC) documents in the last 10 months, according to the Transport Department's data. The development came as the Delhi government on October 12 announced that vehicles without PUC papers would be barred from refuelling in the Capital. The government rescinded the order on October 25.

121.title: I don't think B'wood is facing any negativity, my films did well: Anupam
121.article_body: Veteran actor Anupam Kher said in an interview that Bollywood is not facing any negativity, adding that two of his films have emerged as blockbusters this year. "I say it proudly, 'The Kashmir Files' did ₹350 crore, 'Karthikeya 2' did ₹130 crore. I'm riding on ₹480 crore right now," he said, adding, "If it's a good film, it'll do well."

122.title: 9 rescued, dozens missing after migrant boat sinks off Greek island
122.article_body: A search and rescue operation was launched on Tuesday for dozens of migrants after their boat capsized and drowned off the coast of a Greek island near the capital Athens. The Greek Coast Guard said nine survivors, all men, had been found on an uninhabited islet. According to the rescued men, nearly 68 people were on board the ill-fated vessel.

123.title: Pic of B'luru auto carrying toffees, books for commuters goes viral
123.article_body: A picture of an autorickshaw carrying sanitisers and snacks like biscuits and toffees for passengers in Bengaluru has gone viral on Twitter. The picture showed that driver Rajesh also keeps devotional books, water bottles and bandages in his vehicle. A netizen said, "Even the cabs of Ola, Uber [and] Meru...don't have anything like this considering that they charge much more!"

124.title: Accident victim's sister to get free education: Bangalore University
124.article_body: Bangalore University (BU) has decided to provide free education to the younger sister of Shilpashree, the 23-year-old postgraduate student who died in a road accident inside the campus last month. The victim's family, however, said the university had promised a government job. Some of the university staff have also decided to donate one day's salary to the victim's family.

125.title: PM respected abroad because of India’s deep-rooted democracy: Gehlot
125.article_body: Congress leader and Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Tuesday said PM Narendra Modi gets respect globally because of India's deep-rooted democracy. "[PM Modi] gets the respect because he is the Prime Minister of the country of Gandhi, where the roots of democracy run deep and where, even after more than 70 years of independence, democracy is alive," CM Gehlot said.

126.title: L&T fined ₹5 lakh, ordered to stop work at BJP office in Delhi: Report
126.article_body: Delhi government has reportedly issued a notice to stop construction work at a BJP office in Delhi. Further, the government has fined construction agency Larsen & Toubro (L&T) ₹5 lakh for violating construction ban in Delhi. Taking to Twitter, Delhi Minister Gopal Rai said, "Huge irregularities found at BJP's under construction office site during surprise inspection under 'Anti Dust Campaign'."

127.title: Bengal won't be left out of CAA implementation process: BJP's Suvendu
127.article_body: BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari on Tuesday claimed the process of CAA implementation has started in the country and West Bengal won't be left out. "The Matua community members and other backward castes like Namasudras will get...benefits soon," Adhikari said. His comment comes after the Centre decided to grant Indian citizenship to minorities mostly from Pakistan, who have migrated to India.

128.title: Johnson & Johnson to buy Abiomed for $16.6 billion
128.article_body: Johnson & Johnson (J&J) said it will buy cardiovascular technology company Abiomed for $16.6 billion to strengthen its medical device segment. Abiomed, which develops technology to treat coronary artery disease and heart failure, will run as a standalone business within J&J once the deal is completed. J&J will pay for the acquisition with a combination of cash and short-term financing.

129.title: I have been forced to come out as bisexual: 18-year-old actor Kit Connor
129.article_body: Actor Kit Connor, who plays a bisexual character in the show 'Heartstopper', tweeted, "I'm [bisexual]. Congrats for forcing an 18-year-old to out himself. I think some of you missed the point of the show." It's being speculated this was in response to allegations of queerbaiting. The allegations surfaced after Connor was spotted holding hands with his female co-star Maia Reficco.

130.title: How does T20 World Cup 2022 Group 1 points table read with 1 match each left?
130.article_body: New Zealand, England and Australia are the top three teams with five points each on Group 1 points table in T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage. New Zealand are on top with a superior net run-rate. Sri Lanka are placed fourth with four points, followed by Ireland. Afghanistan have been eliminated from the semifinals race.

131.title: Women students whipped by Taliban officer while protesting burqa policy, video out
131.article_body: A video has shown female students in Afghanistan getting assaulted after they protested a ban on their entry to a university for not wearing a burqa. The incident reportedly took place outside the gates of Badakhshan University on Sunday. A member of the Taliban's vice and virtue force was seen chasing after students with a whip.

132.title: AAP protest in Bengaluru after city potholes claim two more lives
132.article_body: The AAP staged a protest at Bengaluru's Freedom Park following the death of two youths due to potholes in the city. "It is a state-sponsored massacre. The shameless government...is committing crimes by killing innocent lives," said AAP. The party claimed that the state government delays releasing funds for road repairs if contractors do not agree to pay a commission.

133.title: Rapper Takeoff shot dead at 28 reportedly 'over a game of dice' in US
133.article_body: American rapper Takeoff, who was best known as a member of the hip-hop trio 'Migos', was shot dead at the age of 28 outside a club in Houston, US. Takeoff, whose real name is Kirshnik Khari Ball, was shot dead by a person after a fight reportedly broke out during a dice game. He was pronounced dead on the scene.

134.title: Uber may restrict auto services in some parts of Bengaluru: Official
134.article_body: Ride-hailing platform Uber on Tuesday said it's considering restricting auto-rickshaw services in some parts of Bengaluru. Uber India Head of Central Operations Nitish Bhushan said Uber won't be able to operate within the current 10% commission cap rules in Bengaluru as per Karnataka High Court's temporary orders. "We want to work with the government on appropriate fare regulations," Uber stated.

135.title: DMK leader, who called actresses in Tamil Nadu BJP 'items', booked
135.article_body: DMK leader Saidai Sadiq has been booked for allegedly making derogatory remarks against actresses-turned-BJP leaders in Tamil Nadu. He had called BJP leaders Gayathri Raguramm, Namitha and Gautami "items" and mocked Kushboo Sundar. Sadiq had also said that unlike the DMK, BJP depended on the "actresses" to make inroads into Tamil Nadu.

136.title: Twitter Co-founder Dorsey retains 2.4% indirect stake in company
136.article_body: Twitter Co-founder Jack Dorsey retained a 2.4% indirect stake in the company under the new ownership of Elon Musk, according to a US Securities and Exchange Commission filing. The value of Dorsey's over 18 million shares is nearly $1 billion, the filing revealed. Notably, Musk will serve as Twitter CEO after he completed the $44-billion acquisition on Thursday.

137.title: UP govt to give ₹17,500 'encouragement allowance' to youths for start-up
137.article_body: Uttar Pradesh government is planning to provide a monthly 'encouragement allowance' of ₹17,500 to the youths for a year for setting up businesses. As per the policy, financial assistance of ₹5 lakh would be given to the start-up for making a new product and another grant of ₹7.5 lakh would be given for its launch in the market.

138.title: Delhi HC upholds life sentence of stalker who killed DU student Radhika
138.article_body: The Delhi High Court has upheld the life sentence awarded to the man who murdered Delhi University (DU) student Radhika Tanwar in 2011. Dismissing Vijay Saini's appeal against the conviction, the court said, "[His guilt]...has been proved beyond reasonable doubt." Vijay allegedly stalked Radhika and when she rejected his advances, he shot her with a pistol in a premeditated act.

139.title: How can Punjab's pollution reach Delhi? Minister on Delhi's air pollution
139.article_body: Punjab Agriculture Minister Kuldeep Singh Dhaliwal on Tuesday said Punjab's stubble is not the cause of pollution in Delhi. "Rohtak, Panipat and Sonepat are the ones contributing to Delhi's pollution. How can Punjab's pollution reach Delhi? How can Amritsar's, and not Panipat's smoke, reach Delhi?" he said. "Centre is the only one responsible for this mess," Dhaliwal added.

140.title: Srinagar-Leh highway closed after rainfall, light snowfall in J&K
140.article_body: The Srinagar-Leh highway was closed for traffic after Jammu and Kashmir experienced rainfall and light snowfall, officials said on Tuesday. "The weather is cloudy and snowfall is going on at...few places particularly in Zojila and Sonamarg higher reaches," Mukhtar Ahmad, Deputy Director of IMD, said. In a tweet, traffic department said that Srinagar-Jammu highway and Mughal Road were open.

141.title: It was wake-up call: Madan Lal on India's loss vs South Africa in T20 WC
141.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Madan Lal said the loss against South Africa in ongoing T20 World Cup was a wake-up call for Team India. "Because we didn't perform as we would've liked...I'd like to commend the bowlers because, at one stage, we thought that we could win the match," he added. South Africa chased the 134-run target with two balls to spare.

142.title: WhatsApp bans over 26 lakh Indian accounts in September
142.article_body: WhatsApp on Saturday said that it banned over 26 lakh Indian accounts in September 2022. According to WhatsApp's monthly report, the Meta-owned platform received 666 grievance reports from India, of which 496 reports pertained to a 'ban appeal'. The rest of the reports were under categories such as support and safety, the platform added in its report.

143.title: Max Healthcare's net profit rises 216.18% YoY to ₹457 cr in Q2
143.article_body: Max Healthcare Institute on Tuesday reported a 216.18% rise in its consolidated net profit to ₹457.35 crore in the July-September quarter, as against ₹144.65 crore in the year-ago period. The healthcare provider's revenue from operations stood at ₹1,137.12 crore during the quarter, up from ₹1,019.26 crore. The company reported that total expenses increased to ₹897.72 crore.

144.title: Wannabe PM Rahul should first convince his people to elect him as MP: KTR
144.article_body: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao (popularly known as KTR) commented on Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's remarks about TRS' plans to convert into a national party. "International leader Rahul Gandhi who can't even win his own parliament seat in Amethi ridicules Telangana CM KCR's national party ambitions...Wannabe PM should first convince his people to elect him as an MP," KTR said.

145.title: India uses e-rupee to settle ₹2.75 billion of government bonds
145.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India's central bank-backed digital rupee was used to settle secondary market transactions in Indian government bonds worth ₹2.75 billion as part of a pilot. Data showed that trades in a total of three securities – five-year 7.38% 2027 former benchmark 6.54% 2032 and the current benchmark 7.26% 2032 bonds – were settled under the new route.

146.title: 21, including 19 minors, drown during Chhath Puja rituals across Bihar
146.article_body: At least 21 people, including 19 minors, have drowned in separate incidents during Chhath Puja celebrations across Bihar since Sunday. Two boys aged 9 and 13 drowned while cleaning the ghat and a 10-year-old boy drowned while offering 'arghya' in Patna district. Three children from same family also drowned while bathing in Purnea. Many have been reported missing across Bihar.

147.title: Leopard dies after being hit by vehicle on B'luru-Mysuru Expressway
147.article_body: A leopard aged about three years died after allegedly being hit by an unidentified vehicle on the Bengaluru-Mysuru Expressway on Monday morning. The incident took place in Ramanagara district, 50 km from Bengaluru. Forest officials said the speeding vehicle might have hit the animal on its head. A police officer said there are no speed breakers on the expressway.

148.title: Tech Mahindra reports 4% fall in net profit in Q2 at ₹1,285 crore
148.article_body: Tech Mahindra released its results for the Q2 of 2022-23, reporting a 4% fall in consolidated post tax profit to ₹1,285 crore. The company had reported a net profit of ₹1,339 crore in the year-ago period. The company's overall revenue increased to ₹13,129 crore from ₹10,881 crore in the same period last year, registering a 20.7% growth.

149.title: 'Diwale Dulhania...' to re-release in select theatres on SRK's b'day
149.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan's 1995 film 'Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge' will re-release on November 2 to mark the actor's 57th birthday. As per Yash Raj Films' Instagram post, the film will release in PVR, INOX and Cinepolis theatres across India. 'Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge', directed by Aditya Chopra, also featured Kajol and late actor Amrish Puri.

150.title: Temple chariot collapses in K'taka; video shows devotees running to safety
150.article_body: A chariot fell down due to a broken wheel while it was being carried by devotees during 'Rathotsava' at Sri Veerabhadreshwara Temple in Karnataka's Chamarajanagar. No injury has been reported so far. In a video that has surfaced on social media, devotees are seen running to safety as soon as the chariot collapsed.

151.title: Decomposed body of man travels nearly 900 km in toilet of Jansewa Express
151.article_body: The decomposed body of an unidentified man was recovered from a toilet in Jansewa Express at Uttar Pradesh's Roza Railway Station. The body travelled at least 900 km undetected from Bihar's Banmankhi station. The GRP personnel broke open the toilet door after passengers complained of a foul smell emanating from inside. No ID card was found on him, police said.

152.title: IAEA begins probe of Russian claim about Kyiv making 'dirty bombs'
152.article_body: The International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) on Monday said it had started inspection of two Ukrainian nuclear sites where Russia claims Kyiv is manufacturing "dirty bombs" for use in the ongoing Russia-Ukraine conflict. The inspections had been requested by Kyiv in the wake of the accusations. Both sites being investigated "have been visited regularly by IAEA inspectors", the agency said.

153.title: Monkey roams around in Delhi Metro station, clears security check
153.article_body: A video of a monkey roaming around in a Delhi Metro station has gone viral on social media. In the video, the monkey can be seen casually walking and making its way to clear the security check at Nawada station of Blue Line Metro. Reacting to the video, an Instagram user wrote, "Token toh lele [Take the token]."

154.title: FirstMeridian Business Services gets SEBI's approval for ₹800 crore IPO
154.article_body: SEBI has given its approval to staffing firm FirstMeridian Business Services to raise up to ₹800 crore through an initial public offering (IPO). The IPO will include a fresh issue of equity shares worth up to ₹50 crore and an Offer for Sale (OFS) worth up to ₹750 crore by promoters and existing shareholders.

155.title: Why is NASA preparing to shine a 'flashlight' on the Moon's surface?
155.article_body: NASA has said its 'Lunar Flashlight' (a small satellite the size of a briefcase) is ready to launch in November. The satellite will use lasers "to search for water ice inside the darkest craters at the Moon's South Pole", NASA said. The satellite, that'll be launched on a SpaceX rocket, will take three months to reach its science orbit.

156.title: AIMIM aligned with BJP, its 'only job' is to cut votes of Cong: Jairam
156.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Tuesday criticised the AIMIM, saying the party is aligned with the BJP and its "only job" is to fight polls to cut votes of the Congress. "There's no doubt that they take oxygen from the BJP and AIMIM gives booster dose to the BJP," Ramesh said. His comment comes as 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' reached Hyderabad.

157.title: Building a product to disrupt LinkedIn, to make resumes irrelevant: Unacademy CEO
157.article_body: Unacademy Group's Founder and CEO Gaurav Munjal on Tuesday said that the edtech startup's R&D team is working on a product that wants to disrupt LinkedIn. He asked Twitter users for suggestions on naming the new product and he also suggested four names - 'ProjectX', 'nextlevel', 'Unprofile' and 'Jobkey'. In another tweet, he said, "We want to make resumes irrelevant."

158.title: Ban on loud music post 10 pm only in Jubilee Hills pubs in Hyd: HC
158.article_body: The Telangana High Court has lifted restrictions on playing loud music in Hyderabad pubs after 10 pm with the exception of those in the neighbourhood of Jubilee Hills. In September, a single judge bench of the HC had banned all pubs from playing loud music after 10 pm and ordered adherence to permissible noise levels.

159.title: Online gaming unicorn Games24x7 launches ₹400 cr fund for startups
159.article_body: Online gaming unicorn Games24x7 launched a ₹400 crore fund to invest in interactive entertainment startups. The fund will be used over the next five years and Chief Financial Officer Rahul Tewari said the money will come from its own balance sheet. Founded by Bhavin Pandya and Trivikraman Thampy, Games24x7 raised $75 million earlier this year at a $2.5 billion valuation.

160.title: Police seize drugs worth ₹85 lakh in Mumbai's Wadala, 1 arrested
160.article_body: The Mumbai Police on Monday seized drugs worth ₹85 lakh from Wadala and arrested one person, 28-year-old Zahid Tipu Sultan Khan, in the case. According to police, at around 11 pm, they spotted a man on a bike and checking led to the recovery of around 16.18 kg of charas. Police have registered a case under sections of NDPS Act.

161.title: Massive asteroid that could pose threat to Earth found hiding in Sun's glare
161.article_body: Astronomers discovered three near-Earth asteroids hiding in Sun's glare. One of them is the largest "potentially hazardous" object spotted in last eight years, according to NOIRLab. "Our...survey is scouring...area within...orbits of Earth...We've found two large near-Earth asteroids that are about 1 km across, a size...we call planet killers," said an astronomer on two of the three asteroids.

162.title: Our son put Riteish and me on the road to veganism: Genelia
162.article_body: On the occasion of World Vegan Day, actor-couple Genelia Deshmukh and Riteish Deshmukh spoke about turning vegan. Genelia credited their son for putting her and Riteish "on the road to veganism". "He...told me, 'Aai, you love Flash (our dog) and you eat chicken...Both are animals. What's the difference?' That put me on...road to understanding what I was doing," she said.

163.title: Dog owner beats security guard with stick in Gurugram; video viral
163.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media, showing a dog owner allegedly beating a security guard with a stick on Saturday in Gurugram. The incident took place when the man, who is reportedly a society member, was stopped by the guard from walking his dog in a part of the society. The guard suffered severe injuries in the incident.

164.title: Was duped by a staff member, I trusted her way too much: Urfi
164.article_body: 'Bigg Boss OTT' fame Urfi Javed in a recent interview revealed that she was duped by a staff member, leading to her losing several lakhs of money. "It was my fault...I trusted her way too much," she added. Urfi further said she doesn't intend to file any complaints against the former staff member, as "she was once dear" to her.

165.title: Over 75 planes of Indian carriers grounded due to technical issues: CAPA
165.article_body: Global aviation consultancy firm CAPA said on Tuesday that more than 75 planes of Indian carriers are currently grounded due to maintenance and engine-related issues. The planes, accounting for around 10-12% of Indian fleet, will have a significant impact on financials in the second half, CAPA said. CAPA added that non-supply issues are also expected to emerge next year.

166.title: Sun Pharma Q2 profit rises 10.5% YoY to ₹2,262 cr, revenue up 14%
166.article_body: Sun Pharmaceutical Industries on Tuesday reported a 10.5% year-over-year increase in its consolidated net profit to ₹2,262 crore in the July-September quarter. The company saw a nearly 14% rise in its total revenue from operations at ₹10,952 crore from ₹9,626 crore in the year ago quarter. Shares of the pharma major closed at ₹1,033 on BSE.

167.title: PM Modi meets those injured in Morbi bridge collapse at civil hospital
167.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday visited Morbi civil hospital where over 100 people injured in the suspension bridge collapse are admitted. At least 135 people were killed in the incident. Pictures showed PM Modi enquiring about a patient's health at the hospital. The hospital was painted overnight for PM Modi's visit.

168.title: Fintech startup Decentro raises $4.7 million in Series A round
168.article_body: Decentro, a Y Combinator-backed startup that helps firms enter the fintech market, has secured $4.7 million in Series A funding round. The round was led by Singapore and US-based Rapyd Ventures, US-based Uncorrelated Ventures and Leonis VC from Europe. Angel investors, including CRED Founder Kunal Shah, Groww CEO Lalit Keshre and Gupshup CEO Beerud Sheth also participated in the round.

169.title: Shubman Gill smashes highest score by an Indian in a T20 knockout match
169.article_body: Punjab opener Shubman Gill on Tuesday smashed his first-ever hundred in T20 cricket. The 23-year-old reached the three-figure mark off 49 deliveries and went on to score 126(55) against Karnataka in quarter-final match of Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy (SMAT) 2022. Shubman's 126 is also the highest score by an Indian in a T20 knockout match.

170.title: Shubman Gill smashes his first-ever hundred in T20 cricket
170.article_body: Punjab opener Shubman Gill on Tuesday smashed his first-ever hundred in T20 cricket. The 23-year-old reached the three-figure mark off 49 deliveries and went on to score 126(55) against Karnataka in quarter-final match of Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy (SMAT) 2022. Shubman's 126 is also the highest score by an Indian in a T20 knockout match.

171.title: Twitter bans over 54,000 accounts in India for sexual, terror content
171.article_body: Twitter has banned 52,141 accounts in India for promoting child sexual exploitation and non-consensual nudity between August 26 and September 25. Twitter, now owned by Elon Musk, removed 1,982 accounts for promoting terrorism. In a monthly report, Twitter said it received 157 complaints from users in India in the same time-frame, out of which action was taken on 129 URLs.

172.title: Pune-based DPSU disposes of 258 tonnes of scrap, makes ₹1.48 crore
172.article_body: Pune-based Defence Public Sector Undertaking Munitions India Limited (MIL) has disposed of 258 tonnes of scrap from its various units. It's earned ₹1.48 crore from the scrap disposal, Indian Express quoted officials as saying. Moreover, 600 tonnes of scrap has been identified that will be disposed of soon. Notably, this was done as part of government's Special Campaign 2.0 initiative.

173.title: Man dies after being pushed off building by robbers in Thane
173.article_body: A 26-year-old vegetable vendor died after he was pushed off a five-storey building by three unidentified men who allegedly robbed him of ₹12,000 in Mumbra, Thane. The incident happened when the deceased, Sujit Rajaram Gupta, had come to the building to collect empty vegetable crates, police said. A case has been registered under IPC sections 302 and 397.

174.title: England hand NZ their first defeat in T20 World Cup 2022, go 2nd on points table
174.article_body: England defeated New Zealand by 20 runs in their T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 Group 1 match on Tuesday. With this, New Zealand suffered their first defeat in the ongoing tournament. New Zealand, England and Australia have accumulated five points each. New Zealand are on top of the table with superior net run-rate (NRR), while England are now second.
