175.title: Income Tax Dept raids Cartier, Rolex retailer Kapoor Watch Company: Report
175.article_body: The Income Tax Department is conducting searches at Kapoor Watch Company, the Indian retailer of Audemars Piguet, Bvlgari, Cartier, Omega and Tag Heuer brands, as per a report. Sources said that around 20 premises were covered in this search which started on Monday morning. All the showrooms and premises of its promotors were covered in this search, the report added.

176.title: New pic of SRK & Deepika Padukone from 'Pathaan' sets leaks online
176.article_body: A new picture of Shah Rukh Khan and Deepika Padukone has leaked from the sets of their upcoming film 'Pathaan', which is going viral on social media platforms. Reportedly, the makers are planning to release the teaser of 'Pathaan' on November 2 to mark Shah Rukh's 57th birthday. The film, directed by Siddharth Anand, will release on January 25, 2023.

177.title: Finnish PM urges Hungary, Turkey to swiftly approve Finland, Sweden's NATO bids
177.article_body: Finland's Prime Minister Sanna Marin has urged Hungary and Turkey to swiftly approve Finland and Sweden's applications for NATO membership. The two Nordic countries asked to join NATO in May in response to Russian invasion of Ukraine but faced objections from Turkey, which accused the nations of giving shelter to groups it considers as terrorists.

178.title: Kartik Aaryan, Kiara Advani's pics from 'Satyaprem...' shoot get leaked
178.article_body: Leaked pics of Kartik Aaryan and Kiara Advani from their shoot for 'Satyaprem Ki Katha' have surfaced. Both of them are currently shooting in Ahmedabad. In one of the leaked pictures, Kiara can be seen sitting behind Kartik on a scooter. After 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2', this will be the second time when Kiara and Kartik will be working together.

179.title: I appeal to innovators to develop techniques to conserve water: Prez Murmu
179.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu stressed on water conservation and appealed to scientists, town planners and innovators to try to develop techniques that will help conserve water resources. "There will be a need to effectively conserve water to meet the demands of our future generation and technology will play an important role in it," said the President.

180.title: Adani Ports Q2 profit rises by 69% to ₹1,677.48 cr, revenue up by 33%
180.article_body: Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone (Adani Ports) reported a 68.5% year-on-year surge in September quarter profit to ₹1,677.48 crore. Consolidated revenue from operations grew by 32.8% to ₹5,210.80 crore as cargo volume increased by 15% year-on-year to 86.6 million metric tonnes. The revenue from port and SEZ activities rose to ₹4,609.29 crore.

181.title: PM Modi visits site of Morbi bridge collapse that killed 135 people
181.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday visited the site of the Morbi bridge collapse which killed at least 135 people and injured around 100 others. Videos and photos from the site showed PM surveying the rescue work and meeting people carrying out the relief operations. He emphasised ensuring that all possible assistance was reaching the affected persons, PMO said.

182.title: 24-yr-old youth arrested for looting 60 sacks of onions in Prayagraj
182.article_body: A 24-year-old youth was arrested for allegedly looting around 60 sacks of onions, along with his two accomplices, from two persons who were carrying the consignment from Prayagraj’s Jasra mandi to Pratapgarh on October 30. The youth, who was staying in Holland Hall hostel illegally, along with his accomplices purportedly held the victims captive for hours in the hostel.

183.title: Tata Motors' total sales rise by 15.5% to 78,335 units in October
183.article_body: Tata Motors said it registered a total sale of 78,335 units in October, witnessing a growth of 15.49%. The company had sold a total of 67,829 units in the same month last year. Tata said total domestic sales were at 76,537 units as against 65,151 units in the year-ago month, an increase of 17%.

184.title: Boss hits junior with clock for failing to meet monthly sales target in Mumbai
184.article_body: A 35-year-old man reportedly hit his junior with table clock after he failed to meet his monthly target of selling health insurance plans in Mumbai. Anand Singh resigned after missing the target and asked the accused, Amit Singh, for incentives, which he denied. When Anand demanded to discuss the matter before other employees, Amit lost his cool and hit him.

185.title: Macau tests 7 lakh residents after detecting 11 COVID-19 cases
185.article_body: Macau, the world's biggest gambling hub, carried out mass testing of its 7,00,000 residents on Tuesday after detecting 11 cases of COVID-19 in the past few days. Authorities had locked down a major casino in the city on Sunday, ordering staff and guests to stay inside until November 1. More than 1,500 people are reportedly sealed inside the casino.

186.title: Aus survivor of Halloween stampede in Seoul blames govt for mismanagement
186.article_body: Nathan Taverniti, 24-year-old Australian who survived stampede that killed over 150 people in Seoul, blamed officials for failing to employ crowd control measures despite anticipating massive turnout during Halloween festivities, The Associated Press reported. Taverniti said there should have been enough police on standby. "This incident is a result of government's mismanagement," Taverniti said.

187.title: Jos Buttler breaks record for smashing most runs for England in T20I cricket history
187.article_body: England white-ball captain Jos Buttler on Tuesday broke the record for scoring most runs for England in T20I cricket history. With his 73(47) against New Zealand in their T20 World Cup 2022 match on Tuesday, Buttler took his tally of runs in T20I cricket to 2,468. He overtook the previous record of 2,458 runs held by ex-England captain Eoin Morgan.

188.title: 22-yr-old Hyd woman who 'jumped' from 5th floor in UAE is alive: Embassy
188.article_body: A 22-year-old Hyderabadi woman who was assumed to be dead after falling from the fifth floor of a building in the UAE is currently undergoing treatment at a hospital, the Indian Embassy in Dubai said. Majlis Bachao Tehreek leader Amjed Ullah Khan said Afsha Begum, who worked as a housemaid in Ajman, had attempted suicide by jumping from the building.

189.title: After 'Chief Twit', Musk changes Twitter bio to 'Twitter Complaint Hotline Operator'
189.article_body:
Elon Musk on Tuesday changed his bio from 'Chief Twit' to 'Twitter Complaint Hotline Operator' and changed his profile picture to a photo of his younger self that is holding a telephone. Musk has been engaging with several Twitter users after reports alleged that the social media company 
may charge its users around $20 for the blue tick verification badge.

190.title: What if I couldn't go to Harvard?: Co-founder as boAt becomes Harvard case study
190.article_body: Electronics maker boAt's Co-founder Aman Gupta on Tuesday took to Instagram to share the news that Harvard Business School has written a case study on boAt. "Harvard Nahee Jaa sake to Kya hua...apna kaam aur apnee company pahucha dee (What if I couldn't go to Harvard? I sent my company and work to Harvard)," he wrote.

191.title: Sh*t version of my film: Kolkata filmmaker on T-Series' 'Mister Mummy'
191.article_body: Kolkata filmmaker Akash Chatterjee has demanded T-Series to credit him for Riteish Deshmukh's film, titled 'Mister Mummy'. In a Facebook post, Akash Chatterjee alleged that T-Series "stole" the script of his film and came up with their "sh*t version" of it. He also shared that his story and concept are registered with Screenwriters Association, Mumbai.

192.title: MMRDA launches 2nd of longest steel decks on Mumbai Trans Harbour Link
192.article_body: The Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA) launched the second of the longest (180 metre) orthotropic steel decks on the Mumbai Trans Harbour Link, a sea link that will connect South Mumbai to Navi Mumbai. The first 180-metre-long steel deck was launched in March 2022. These steel decks weigh as heavy as six large-sized aircraft.

193.title: UPL's Q2 net profit rises by 28% to ₹814 crore, revenue up by 18%
193.article_body: Global crop protection products manufacturer UPL posted a 28.4% year-on-year rise in consolidated net profit at ₹814 crore as against ₹633 crore in the corresponding quarter last fiscal. The company's consolidated revenue from operations surged by 18% year-on-year to ₹12,506 crore. UPL's stock fell by 2.14% on the NSE after the results and it closed 1.63% lower at ₹718.30 apiece.

194.title: 50-yr-old woman suffers stroke after nerve gets pressed during hair wash at Hyd salon
194.article_body: A 50-year-old woman suffered a 'beauty parlour stroke' after getting a hair wash at a salon in Hyderabad. Doctors treating her said that a key vessel supplying blood to the brain was pressed when she bent back her neck for the wash. The term 'beauty parlour stroke syndrome' was coined after it was first reported in 1993 in US.

195.title: BJP's ideology favours rising air pollution: Delhi minister Gopal Rai
195.article_body: Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai criticised the BJP and said that its ideology favours rising air pollution levels as the party voiced support for the bursting of firecrackers. "Punjab would have seen a large-scale reduction in stubble burning had the Centre supported the state government's initiative to provide a cash incentive to farmers for not burning crop residue," he said.

196.title: Survey of 62,000 hawkers & vendors starts in Pune district
196.article_body: The Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) has started a biometric survey of 62,000 hawkers and vendors in the region. Government norms make it mandatory for all civic bodies to survey hawkers every five years. The agency that will conduct the survey will get ₹60 for surveying each hawker.

197.title: 730 crore UPI transactions worth over ₹12 lakh crore conducted in Oct
197.article_body: About 730 crore transactions worth ₹12.11 lakh crore were conducted through Unified Payments Interface (UPI) platform in October, NPCI data showed. This is a 7.7% increase in transaction volume as compared to September's 678 crore transactions. Meanwhile, the number of instant interbank fund transfers through IMPS in October stood at 48.25 crore and the value was at ₹4.66 lakh crore.

198.title: 14 people, including 3 kids, injured in Chicago drive-by shooting
198.article_body: At least 14 people, including three children, were injured in a drive-by shooting on Monday night in the Garfield Park neighbourhood of US' Chicago, police said. The youngest victim was a three-year-old, Chicago Police chief informed. A preliminary probe indicated the involvement of at least two shooters, he added. No suspects have been identified yet, police said late on Monday.

199.title: We haven't purchased Russian oil directly: Sri Lanka Energy Minister
199.article_body: Sri Lankan Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekera has said his country had been buying Russian oil through trading companies in Dubai and Singapore, but not directly from Russia. "We have requested the Russian government for assistance for energy security for Sri Lanka. We have had positive responses but so far no direct supplies," Wijesekera added.

200.title: 1 killed in Russian missile attack in Mykolaiv, apartment building demolished
200.article_body: Russia fired four missiles into Mykolaiv, in southern Ukraine, killing one person and demolishing an apartment building. This comes a day after Russia launched missile attacks on several cities including the capital Kyiv. Russian President Vladimir Putin said that the strikes and decision to suspend grain deal were in response to Ukraine's drone attack on Moscow's fleet in Crimea.

201.title: Video shows dog running with human head in its mouth in Mexico, police pull it out
201.article_body: A dog was filmed in Zacatecas, Mexico, running down the street with a human head hanging out of its mouth. The head and other body parts were abandoned in an automatic teller booth with a message referring to a drug cartel, an official told Fox News. Police were eventually able to pull the head out of the dog's mouth.

202.title: Hyderabad Pride March to be held on November 13 after gap of 3 years
202.article_body: Hyderabad city's Pride March, known as 'Hyderabad Queer Swabhimana Yatra', will be held after a gap of three years on November 13. The city first witnessed the rainbow parade in 2013. Over a thousand individuals are expected to attend the event. The organiser said the event has no rules on attire.

203.title: There wasn't much pressure on him: Afridi on Kohli's dropped catch vs SA
203.article_body: Reacting to Virat Kohli dropping Aiden Markram's catch in India's T20 World Cup 2022 match against South Africa, Shahid Afridi said, "I don't think there was much pressure on Kohli during that catch." "[Teams] seem to be focussing more on their batting and bowling but fielding wins you 70% of games," added Afridi. South Africa defeated India by five wickets.

204.title: Result of massive corruption: Kejriwal on Morbi bridge collapse
204.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday said the Morbi bridge collapse in Gujarat was a result of massive corruption and prayed for those who lost their lives in the incident. "Why was a watchmaking company which had no experience of bridge construction allowed to do so?" Kejriwal questioned. He demanded the resignation of Gujarat CM Bhupendra Patel after the incident.

205.title: AAP contesting Gujarat polls to help BJP: Jairam Ramesh
205.article_body: Congress General Secretary Jairam Ramesh alleged that Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) is contesting elections in Gujarat to help BJP. AAP entered the fray to cut into Congress votes, he further said. "The way AAP leaders are campaigning and raising issues, we see no difference between BJP and AAP. The two parties are engaged in shadowboxing," he said.

206.title: Mumbai Fire Brigade receives 4 ISO certifications for performance & service
206.article_body: The Mumbai Fire Brigade (MFB) has received four certifications from the International Organisation for Standardisation (ISO) for its performance and service, becoming India's first and only such authority to acquire them. The MFB has received certifications in four different parameters. "The brigade's performance will be recorded as per...international standards," Chief Fire Officer of MFB said.

207.title: MTNL and BSNL aim to raise $2.34 billion: Report
207.article_body: MTNL and BSNL are reportedly planning to raise an aggregate of ₹193.56 billion ($2.34 billion) through government-guaranteed bonds. MTNL plans to raise ₹109.10 billion in November. The telecom company is looking to issue bonds maturing in 10 years and will pay a semi-annual coupon. MTNL will meet bankers and investors on Tuesday, according to the report.

208.title: Stubble burning cases in H'yana not even 10% of Punjab's: CM Khattar
208.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar said that the cases of stubble burning in Haryana are not even 10% of that in Punjab. "Last year, there were 2,561 incidents of stubble burning whereas it decreased to 1,925 this year. While 13,873 incidents have taken place in Punjab this year," Khattar added while addressing a press conference in Chandigarh.

209.title: Over 3,000 law students get incorrect marksheets, MU says 'technical glitch'
209.article_body: Over 3,000 law students who graduated from Mumbai University have received their final year marksheets with the wrong Permanent Roll Number (PRN), jeopardising their future plans. "I applied for an LLM course at another college. During the marksheet verification process, I was told my PRN was invalid," said a student. The university claimed that the error was a "technical glitch".

210.title: Kerala airport halts flights for 5 hrs for 'God's passage' through runway
210.article_body: Thiruvananthapuram International Airport closed its runway and halted flight operations for five hours from 4 pm to 9 pm on Tuesday to enable the smooth passage of the procession of Sree Padmanabhaswamy Temple. The airport has been halting flight operations twice every year for decades for the bi-annual ceremonial procession that passes through the runway.

211.title: 18 persons cheated of ₹10,000 each on the pretext of job offers in Noida
211.article_body: As many as 18 persons have been cheated of at least ₹10,000 each on the pretext of getting jobs at a mobile company in Noida, police said. On Sunday, the victims submitted a complaint at the Sector 20 police station against the suspects, police added. "We have also inquired about the said company in Surajpur," police further said.

212.title: Doing a biopic on Sonia Gandhi would be interesting: Mahima Chaudhry
212.article_body: Actress Mahima Chaudhry, who will soon feature in Kangana Ranaut's directorial 'Emergency', has said that doing a biopic on former Congress President Sonia Gandhi would be interesting. "Her journey notably from Italy to India, and then becoming a political figure," Mahima further stated. The 'Pardes' actress will play the role of writer and activist Pupul Jayakar in 'Emergency'.

213.title: Tesla may begin mass production of Cybertruck by 2023 end: Report
213.article_body: Tesla is reportedly aiming to begin mass production of its pick-up truck, Cybertruck, by the end of 2023. The Cybertruck was unveiled in 2019 by Elon Musk, and last month Tesla said that it would be readying its Austin, Texas plant for its early production. In January, Musk pushed the launch of Cybertruck to 2023, citing shortages in sourcing components.

214.title: Cong to take out yatras in states not covered by Rahul's march: Jairam
214.article_body: The Congress party is organising Bharat Jodo Yatras in states not covered by the main walkathon led by party leader Rahul Gandhi, Congress' Jairam Ramesh said on Tuesday. He announced this during the Bharat Jodo Yatra which entered Hyderabad today. "In the next few days yatras will also be undertaken in Bihar and Jharkhand," Jairam said.

215.title: Chhattisgarh CM inaugurates tribal dance fest, shares pics & videos
215.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel inaugurated the third edition of the National Tribal Dance Festival in Raipur today. The state CM's Office also shared pictures and videos of the festival on Twitter, some of which were of artists parading to the tune of the song 'Sare Jahan Se Achha Hindustan Hamara'. This comes as the state celebrates its foundation day today.

216.title: Tata to add 45,000 women workers at iPhone plant in Tamil Nadu: Report
216.article_body: Tata Group is reportedly planning to hire 45,000 women workers at its electronics factory, that makes iPhone components in Tamil Nadu's Hosur, in 18 to 24 months. Tata Group is reportedly in talks with Wistron to build an electronics manufacturing joint venture, seeking to assemble iPhones in India. Tata had established the plant with an investment of ₹5,000 crore.

217.title: Pics show personal belongings of people crushed to death in S Korea stampede
217.article_body: Pictures of the personal belongings of those who were crushed to death during the Halloween stampede in South Korea's Seoul have been released. The items include shoes, jackets and items of clothing as well as masks, belts and toys. Around 150 people, most in their teens and twenties, died in the stampede recently.

218.title: Actor Prateik Babbar gets blue belt in Brazilian jiu-jitsu
218.article_body: Prateik Babbar recently won a blue belt in Brazilian jiu-jitsu. The actor, who has been training for about four years, said, "If there's...lull period in my life, MMA gives me balance...I think it's fuel for my soul. This is something I want to do for...rest of my life." Prateik added his ultimate goal is to become a black belt holder.

219.title: Pak's batting is always a problem, it's never solid enough: De Villiers
219.article_body: Ex-South Africa captain AB de Villiers said Pakistan's batting has "always" been a problem, adding that it is "never" solid enough. "It always goes up and down," stated De Villiers. Pakistan recently suffered a defeat against Zimbabwe in a T20 World Cup 2022 match. Discussing the loss, ex-Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq had said, "Our batters were beaten at least 40 times."

220.title: Putin's hands 'stained in blood': Ukraine seeks Russia's expulsion from G20
220.article_body: Russia should be expelled from the G20 and President Vladimir Putin's invitation to a summit in Bali next month must be revoked, Ukraine's Foreign Ministry Spokesperson said. "Putin publicly acknowledged ordering missile strikes on Ukrainian civilians and energy infrastructure. With his hands stained in blood, he mustn't be allowed to sit at the table with world leaders," Oleg Nikolenko added.

221.title: When PM Modi goes abroad he receives great honour: Gehlot
221.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Tuesday said when PM Narendra Modi goes abroad, he receives great honour. "He's PM of the nation of Gandhi, where democracy is deep-rooted. When the world realises this, they feel proud that the PM of that country is coming to them," Gehlot added. Gehlot and PM Modi attended an event in Rajasthan today.

222.title: Woman mowed down by bus in Delhi while trying to cross road
222.article_body: A 27-year-old woman was run over by a bus while she was trying to cross a road in Delhi's Karol Bagh. The entire incident was captured on CCTV. The incident happened when the deceased Sapna, who worked as a receptionist, was heading towards her workplace. "We have seized the bus and are looking for bus owner and driver," police said.

223.title: Rescue operation underway for 3rd day in Morbi bridge collapse site
223.article_body: The rescue operation after the collapse of a suspension bridge in Gujarat's Morbi continued for the third day on Tuesday. At least 135 people died and several others were injured in the incident that took place on Sunday. NDRF said that 12 boats along with a team of 125 people have been deployed at the spot.

224.title: Nykaa shares surge as Q2 net profit rises by 333%, revenue up by 39%
224.article_body: Nykaa parent FSN E-Commerce Ventures reported a 333% surge in September-quarter net profit at ₹5.2 crore as against ₹1.17 crore a year earlier. The company's quarterly revenue from operations recorded a 39% year-on-year increase to ₹1,230.8 crore. At 3:17 pm, the stock was trading 2.88% higher at ₹1,186/piece on NSE. Last week, its stock had tumbled below the ₹1,000 mark.

225.title: Rajinikanth to attend Puneeth Rajkumar's Karnataka Ratna award ceremony
225.article_body: Actor Rajinikanth arrived in Bengaluru to attend an event organised by the Karnataka government to posthumously honour late actor Puneeth Rajkumar with the Karnataka Ratna award. The award is the highest civilian honour conferred by the state. Around 5,000 people are expected to arrive for the event, which will take place on Tuesday evening.

226.title: Sanjay Dutt to star in horror comedy 'The Vir-gin Tree'
226.article_body: Actor Sanjay Dutt is all set to star in a horror comedy movie, titled 'The Vir-gin Tree'. The movie will be produced by Sanjay's Three Dimension Motion Pictures Pvt Ltd and Deepak Mukut's Soham Rockstar Entertainment. In addition to Sanjay, 'The Vir-gin Tree' will also star Sunny Singh, Mouni Roy and Palak Tiwari among others in pivotal roles.

227.title: No police officer who commits wrongs should be protected: Kerala CM
227.article_body: No police officer who commits wrongs should be protected, Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan said on Tuesday adding that such a stand would ensure that everyone worked honestly and without fear. Speaking on the occasion of Kerala Police Formation Day, the CM said there were isolated incidents of police personnel or officers indulging in activities which were wrong.

228.title: 24-year-old woman gang-raped at burial ground in Hyderabad
228.article_body: Two men were arrested in Hyderabad on Monday, hours after they allegedly raped a 24-year-old woman at a burial ground in Ghulam Murtuza Chawni. Ibrahim Baig and Mirza Omer Baig had run away from the scene after committing the crime. Locals took the victim to a police station. The accused were booked under Sections 376D and 376(2)(l) of the IPC.

229.title: US SC rejects Turkey's plea to quash lawsuits over 2017 brawl
229.article_body: The US Supreme Court on Monday dismissed Turkey's plea to quash civil lawsuits in US courts pertaining to a violent brawl outside the Turkish ambassador's residence in Washington on May 16, 2017. The incident took place during a visit by Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan. Erdogan's bodyguards were accused of attacking protesters critical of his government, without any provocation.

230.title: Musk wears ₹6 lakh Halloween costume, people confused about his inspiration
230.article_body: The world's richest man Elon Musk wore a leather costume for Halloween that is available for $7,500 (over ₹6 lakh) online. The costume was listed as 'Devil's Champion' on a website. After Musk shared his pictures on Twitter, several people couldn't identify whether he was dressed as a known character or who was the inspiration behind his costume.

231.title: Surrogacy has become a big deal as some actors tried it: Varalaxmi
231.article_body: Actress Varalaxmi Sarathkumar said that surrogacy has become a "big deal for buzz as some of the actors have tried it". She also clarified that her upcoming film 'Yashoda' talks about surrogacy but doesn't "mention its good or bad effects". She will be seen playing the head of a surrogacy facility centre in 'Yashoda', which also stars Samantha Ruth Prabhu.

232.title: 23,547 autorickshaws, taxis in Mumbai fined for refusing passengers in Oct
232.article_body: Mumbai Traffic Police (MTP) has fined 23,547 autorickshaws and taxis for refusing short-distance rides in October. Out of these cases, 15,395 autorickshaws were fined ₹50 each, and 8,152 taxis were fined ₹200 each. Earlier this month, MTP issued a notice stating action would be taken against autorickshaws and taxis that refuse to accept customers based on the fare and distance.

233.title: Zimbabwe are a lot better mentally than some of the big teams: Raza
233.article_body: Zimbabwe middle-order batter Sikandar Raza said Zimbabwe are in a "lot better place" mentally in comparison to some of the big teams competing in the T20 World Cup 2022. "We're not going in there to...merely exist...We're going to bring our brand of cricket...and see what happens," added Raza. Zimbabwe will next face Netherlands in the T20 World Cup 2022.

234.title: Gas leak at factory in Ludhiana, 5 persons left unconscious
234.article_body: A carbon dioxide leak at a factory in Ludhiana's Giaspura left five persons unconscious on Tuesday morning, police said. "The leaked gas formed a thick layer in the air and reduced visibility. Five workers in the adjoining unit fainted after inhaling the gas," an official said. The incident occurred when liquid carbon dioxide was being transferred from a tanker.

235.title: Gurugram hospital booked for operating without fire safety clearance
235.article_body: A private hospital named World Laparoscopy Hospital in DLF Phase-2, Gurugram was booked for allegedly functioning without a fire safety clearance and occupancy certificate. An FIR was filed on the directions of a city court after a complaint was made by the Municipal Corporation of Gurugram. However, the hospital said that they are in the process of getting the certificates.

236.title: Suniel bought half of my film's tickets as they were unsold: Jackie
236.article_body: Actor Jackie Shroff, who appeared on KBC 13 with Suniel Shetty, recalled an incident when Suniel had bought half of his film's tickets as they were unsold. "Someone...told us, 'Jackie, all the tickets of your new release haven't been sold yet'...[Suniel] said, 'Buy all the unsold tickets. His movie should have a full audience'," Jackie stated.

237.title: Cong President Mallikarjun Kharge to join Bharat Jodo Yatra in Hyderabad
237.article_body: Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge will be joining Bharat Jodo Yatra in Hyderabad this evening, the first time he will do so after becoming the party President. Congress MP Rahul Gandhi and Kharge will hoist the tricolour near the Charminar at the same spot where former Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi hoisted the flag in the 1980s.

238.title: I remove my shoes when I go to meet well-wishers, it's a devotion for me: Big B
238.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan, in his latest blog post, said that he removes his shoes when he goes to meet his well-wishers. He said that meeting his well-wishers is a devotion for him. In one of the pictures shared on his blog post, the actor can be seen removing his footwear. He also spoke about the crowd outside his house.

239.title: Some Pak players would sneak out & eat burgers: Afridi on attitude to fitness
239.article_body: Discussing the attitude of some Pakistan players towards fitness, ex-Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi said, "I know a few players who were called by PCB to the High Performance Centre...[for] their diet and training." "However...they [would]...sneak out to eat burgers," added Afridi. "If [players] are not serious about their fitness...PCB can't keep an eye...all the time," he stated.

240.title: US Prez Biden, First Lady host their first Halloween at White House
240.article_body: US President Joe Biden and First Lady Jill Biden on Monday welcomed trick-or-treaters to the White House to celebrate Halloween. It was the Bidens' first time welcoming trick-or-treaters as President and First Lady. Biden wore a navy raincoat and baseball cap, while Jill was dressed in butterfly wings and a purple wig. The treats included chocolate kisses and candy bars.

241.title: Salman is a family guy, respects his parents so much: Sooraj Barjatya
241.article_body: Director Sooraj Barjatya said that Salman Khan might project being someone else, but essentially, he's "a family guy". "He's that elder son who loves his brothers, sisters and respects his parents," Barjatya mentioned, adding that he has never seen someone "more respectful than him". He also confirmed that he has written a version of his family drama with Salman.

242.title: No team can be taken lightly: Dravid ahead of India-Bangladesh T20 WC game
242.article_body: Ahead of India-Bangladesh T20 World Cup Super 12 stage match, India head coach Rahul Dravid said no team can be taken lightly. "At times, it's two hits here and two there. These conditions have made the contest a level-playing field. The grounds are big," he stated. Match will be played on Wednesday. India lost their last match against South Africa.

243.title: 50 nations condemn China's crimes against Uyghurs in Xinjiang
243.article_body: Fifty countries have signed a statement condemning China's crimes against Uyghurs in Xinjiang region. The signatories, including US, Britain, Japan, France, and Somalia among others, called for UN's "urgent attention" against China's treatment of Uyghurs. In August, a UN report said that China was committing serious human rights violations in Xinjiang under anti-extremism policies.

244.title: Chinese billionaire Wu Yajun quits as chairperson from her firm amid real estate crisis
244.article_body: Wu Yajun, the 58-year-old billionaire co-founder of Beijing-based property developer Longfor Properties, has resigned as the chairperson of the company amid the real estate crisis in China. Meanwhile, in an exchange filing, the company said that she stepped down due to health and age reasons. Notably, Yajun topped the Hurun Richest Self-Made Women in the World 2022 list.

245.title: Piyush Goyal condoles demise of Jamshed J Irani, calls him 'changemaker'
245.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Tuesday condoled the demise of Dr Jamshed J Irani, widely known as the 'Steel Man of India', who passed away aged 86 in Jamshedpur late Monday night. Goyal said, "Padma Bhushan...Jamshed J Irani was a changemaker, who helped build trust for Brand India globally." Irani served as the Managing Director of Tata Steel from 1992-2001.

246.title: Salman Khan gets Y+ security cover after threats, X category for Akshay Kumar: Reports
246.article_body: Mumbai Police will provide Y+ security cover to actor Salman Khan. The step has been taken by the state government after he received a threat letter from Lawrence Bishnoi gang earlier, said Maharashtra Police. Actor Akshay Kumar has also been reportedly given X-category security cover. According to reports, Akshay was granted security because of social media threats over his nationality.

247.title: State transport bus Shivshahi catches fire in Pune's Yerawada, video surfaces
247.article_body: State transport bus Shivshahi caught fire in Pune's Yerawada on Tuesday. A video of the incident was shared by Free Press Journal. Reports said that all of the 42 passengers of the bus are safe. The incident took place when the passengers were out of the bus and it was parked on the side of the road.

248.title: India are here to win World Cup, we aren't here to win it: Shakib Al Hasan
248.article_body: Ahead of India-Bangladesh T20 World Cup 2022 clash, Bangladesh captain Shakib Al Hasan said that India are here to win the World Cup, adding that they are the favourites. "We aren't here to win the World Cup. If we beat them then it will be an upset. We will try to create an upset," he added.

249.title: Who is Sriram Krishnan, the engineer helping Elon Musk at Twitter?
249.article_body: Indian American investor, technologist and engineer Sriram Krishnan is temporarily helping out Twitter's new owner Elon Musk with making changes to the micro-blogging site. Krishnan, who did his B.Tech from SRM Engineering College in Tamil Nadu, has previously worked at Facebook, Snap, and Twitter. He's a General Partner at a16z, the firm which invested in Musk's buyout of Twitter.

250.title: Delhi Minister Satyendar Jain good friend of conman Sukesh: BJP
250.article_body: BJP leader Sambit Patra alleged that Delhi Minister Satyendar Jain is a good friend of conman Sukesh Chandrasekhar. Patra also alleged that Jain used to regularly meet Chandrasekhar in Tihar Jail. Jain's secretary told the conman that he needs to pay ₹2 crore every month for basic facilities inside the prison, the BJP leader further alleged.

251.title: Maruti Suzuki sees 21% rise in Oct sales, 1,67,520 units sold last month
251.article_body: India's largest carmaker Maruti Suzuki India on Tuesday reported a 21% increase in its total sales in October 2022, as 1,67,520 units were sold in the last month. It had sold 1,38,335 units in the same month last year. While the company's overall domestic passenger vehicle sales rose 26% in October, its sale of compact vehicles rose to 73,685 units.

252.title: PM Modi declares Rajasthan's Mangarh Dham a national monument
252.article_body: PM Narendra Modi declared Rajasthan's Mangarh Dham a national monument. PM paid tributes to tribals who were massacred by the British army in 1913 in Mangarh. Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot, Gujarat CM Bhupendra Patel and Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan were present at the event. "Mangarh is a shared heritage of people of Rajasthan, Maharashtra, MP...Gujarat," PM Modi said.

253.title: Anil was told he's ruining his career with 'Mr India': Boney Kapoor
253.article_body: Producer Boney Kapoor revealed that people told Anil Kapoor that 'Mr India' would ruin his career as he would be invisible in major portions of the film. "I had faith...I told Anil that you'll be remembered as Mr India till your last breath," Boney added. The filmmaker further added that he was "broke" after the completion of the film.

254.title: Mother allegedly kills her 10-day-old boy in Karnataka's Mangaluru; booked
254.article_body: A woman has been booked in Karnataka’s Mangaluru for allegedly throwing her 10-day-old baby boy into a well. The accused has been identified as Pavithra, who was suffering from post-natal depression. She wanted to have a baby girl. However, when she had a boy, she was reportedly upset and killed the infant as her wish was not fulfilled.

255.title: Rahul is fantastic, I & Rohit have no doubt over who'll open: Dravid
255.article_body: Rahul Dravid said India opener KL Rahul is a "fantastic" player, adding that he's confident about Rahul making a strong comeback. Dravid stated that he and Rohit Sharma have "no doubt" over the other opener barring Rohit. "I know how much impact Rahul can make," he said. Rahul has scored 22 runs in the T20 World Cup 2022 so far.

256.title: Rohith Vemula's mother joins Bharat Jodo Yatra, meets Rahul Gandhi
256.article_body: On day 55 of the Congress' Bharat Jodo Yatra, party MP Rahul Gandhi met the mother of Rohith Vemula, a Dalit student of the University of Hyderabad who died by suicide in 2016 after an episode of alleged harassment. She showed her support by walking briefly with Rahul Gandhi during the morning leg of the yatra in Telangana’s Shamshabad.

257.title: Impossible for any auto firm to be profitable in 1st yr: MG Motor India
257.article_body: Responding to the Corporate Affairs Ministry's notice to MG Motor India regarding its operational losses in 2019-2020, the automaker said, "It is impossible for any automobile company to be profitable in the very first year of its operations." Ministry had reportedly started the probe after an analysis of the automaker's statements that indicated suspicious transactions and other irregularities.

258.title: I know if I eat a paratha, coach will make me pay for it in training the next day: Neeraj
258.article_body: India's Olympic gold medal-winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra, in a recent interview, said that he lost control after winning the gold medal at Olympics and gained weight. "Now I am controlling but in training...I know if I eat a paratha or something the coach will make me pay for it during training the next day," the 24-year-old said.

259.title: Son of ex-Punjab Police head constable arrested for murder in Chandigarh
259.article_body: Chandigarh Police arrested a 24-year-old man for allegedly killing a woman, whose body was recovered on October 28 behind the Sukhna Lake. The arrested man, Jagroop Singh, is the son of a late Punjab Police head constable, who passed away on duty last year, according to the police. Jagroop was purportedly in a relationship with the woman.

260.title: Twitter engineers asked to look at Vine's code for its revival: Report
260.article_body: Elon Musk's team has asked Twitter engineers to look into short video app Vine's code to see how much work it would take to revive it, media reports said citing sources. Musk started a Twitter poll on Sunday on whether he should bring back Vine. He has instructed engineers to work on a reboot that could be ready by year-end.

261.title: Unacceptable for ships to cross Black Sea after grain deal suspension: Russia
261.article_body: Russia has said it is "unacceptable" for ships to pass through Black Sea security corridor after it suspended participation in grain deal. The Russian Defence Ministry accused Ukraine of using security corridor to conduct military operations against Russia. It said there can be no question of guaranteeing security until Ukraine accepts obligation to not use Black Sea for military purposes.

262.title: Italian mafia kingpin wanted since 2015 captured in Argentina
262.article_body: Argentina's police have arrested a top Italian mobster wanted since 2015. Carmine Alfonso Maiorano, leader of the Italian 'Ndrangheta mafia, is accused by international authorities of carrying out drug trafficking and arms trafficking operations in Latin America and Europe. Interpol considers 'Ndrangheta as "one of the most extensive and powerful criminal organizations in the world".

263.title: Saudi Aramco's Q3 net income rises by 39% on higher crude prices
263.article_body: Saudi Arabian state oil producer, Saudi Aramco, reported a 39% rise in its third-quarter net income to $42.4 billion, led by higher crude oil prices and sales volume. Its free cash flow rose to $45 billion year-on-year from $28.7 billion. It also declared a dividend of $18.8 billion in the third quarter, which will be paid in the fourth quarter.

264.title: Singer AP Dhillon suffers injury during tour in US, shares pic from hospital
264.article_body: Singer AP Dhillon has been hospitalised after suffering an injury while on a tour in the US. Sharing a picture of his bandaged arm on Instagram, Dhillon announced that his shows in Los Angeles and San Francisco are being postponed. "I'm doing well and...expected to fully recover. However, I will not be able to perform at this time," he wrote.

265.title: Foxconn hikes daily bonuses by 4 times for staff amid COVID-19 curbs in China
265.article_body: After videos showed workers escaping from iPhone maker Foxconn’s Zhengzhou plant in China amid COVID-19 restrictions, Foxconn has quadrupled bonuses to retain staff at the manufacturing site. According to the WeChat account of Foxconn's Zhengzhou plant, daily bonuses for employees have been raised to 400 yuan for November from 100 yuan. Foxconn produces 70% of iPhone shipments globally.

266.title: I lost control after Olympics and gained weight: Neeraj Chopra
266.article_body: India's Olympic gold medal-winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra, in a recent interview, said that he lost control after winning the gold medal at Olympics and gained weight. "Now I am controlling but in training...I know if I eat a paratha or something the coach will make me pay for it during training the next day," the 24-year-old said.

267.title: Europeans ask me if Indians have to return the money parents spend on raising them: Neeraj
267.article_body: India's Olympic gold medal-winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra, in an interview, said people in Europe ask him if Indians have to return the money parents spend on raising them after they start earning. "I tell them it’s different here. I think it’s only in our culture that even after growing up we live with our parents as kids," Neeraj said.

268.title: SaaS startup Icertis raises $150 million from Silicon Valley Bank
268.article_body: Software-as-a-service (SaaS) startup Icertis has secured $150 million through revolving credit facility and convertible debt from US-based Silicon Valley Bank. After the latest funding round, the company's total capital has reached $520 million. The company was co-founded by former Aztecsoft CEO Samir Bodas and former BladeLogic executive Monish Darda in 2009.

269.title: Couple, maid found dead under mysterious circumstances in Delhi
269.article_body: A couple and their maid were found dead at their residence in Delhi's Hari Nagar area under mysterious circumstances, police said on Tuesday. The CCTV footage of the area is being analysed to identify the culprits and a murder case has been filed, according to the police. Officials said that the couple's two-year-old daughter was found safe, according to reports.

270.title: 2 men stab dog to death after it constantly barks at them for days in MP
270.article_body: Two men aged between 20 and 25 years stabbed a stray dog to death using a knife in Madhya Pradesh. The two said that the dog had been constantly barking at them for days. An official said that the two accused got angry after the dog barked at them again on Sunday night. The dog died on the spot.

271.title: Didn't sleep, helped people entire night: Eyewitness of Morbi bridge collapse
271.article_body: An eyewitness to Gujarat's Morbi bridge collapse incident said that he saw people hanging from cables and then slipping down. The eyewitness, who sells tea near the bridge every Sunday, said, "I didn't sleep and helped people the entire night. It was heart-wrenching to see a 7-8-month-pregnant woman die. Never saw anything like that in my life," he added.

272.title: Police destroy 400 kg of drugs seized in 133 cases in Ambala
272.article_body: Police have destroyed 400 kg of drugs which had been seized in 133 cases at a waste management unit in Haryana's Ambala on Monday. The drugs included 2.98 kg of chura post, 91.8 kg of ganja, 900 gm of heroin, 1.5 kg of sulfa, 10 gm of charas and several intoxicant capsules, tablets, injections and syrups, a police spokesperson said.

273.title: Was forced to pay ₹10 cr to AAP's Satyendar Jain as 'protection money': Conman Sukesh
273.article_body: In a letter to Delhi L-G VK Saxena, jailed conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar has alleged that he was forced to pay ₹10 crore to Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leader Satyendar Jain as "protection money". Sukesh said that a total amount of ₹50 crore was paid to the AAP as he was promised an important party position in south India.

274.title: Video of monkey drinking beer near UP liquor shop goes viral; shopkeepers file complaint
274.article_body: A video showing monkey drinking beer near a liquor shop in Uttar Pradesh's Raebareli is going viral on social media. The liquor shopkeepers in the region complained against the monkey accusing it of stealing alcohol from their shops and also snatching bottles from their customers. District Excise Officer Rajendra Pratap Singh said efforts are being made to catch the monkey.

275.title: GST collections rise to ₹1.52 lakh crore in October, 2nd highest ever
275.article_body: India collected ₹1.52 lakh crore in Goods and Services Tax (GST) in October, marking the second-highest monthly collection ever after that in April 2022, the Finance Ministry said. The monthly GST revenues have been over ₹1.40 lakh crore for eight straight months. In October, central GST was ₹26,039 crore, state GST was ₹33,396 crore and integrated GST was ₹81,778 crore.

276.title: Toyota Motor's Q2 profit falls by 25%, FY output target cut to 9.2 mn
276.article_body: Toyota Motor reported a 25% fall in second-quarter operating profit to 562.7 billion yen ($3.79 billion) as against a 749.9-billion yen profit in the corresponding period last year. Toyota said last week that its global production rebounded by 30% in the September quarter. However, it cut its fiscal output target to 9.2 million vehicles on continuing risks to chip supply.

277.title: 4 sickened by carbon dioxide release at Los Angeles airport
277.article_body: Four people, a woman and three men, were sickened by a release of carbon dioxide in a Los Angeles International Airport utility room on Monday. All people hurt in the incident were airport employees and one man is in grave condition, officials said. "The carbon dioxide displaced the oxygen in his bloodstream and he went into cardiac arrest," they said.

278.title: India reports 1,046 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 17,618
278.article_body: India reported 1,046 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 1,326 new COVID-19 cases. The active cases in India now stand at 17,618. The COVID-19 death toll so far has reached 5,29,077 following 53 casualties in the last 24 hours.

279.title: Afghanistan crash out of T20 World Cup 2022 semi-finals race after losing to Sri Lanka
279.article_body: Sri Lanka defeated Afghanistan by six wickets in their T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage Group 1 match on Tuesday. Afghanistan put up a total of 144/8 in their 20 overs, with Sri Lanka chasing down the target in 18.3 overs. With this, Afghanistan have crashed out of the T20 World Cup 2022 semi-finals race.

280.title: Google pauses Play Store billing in India after ₹936-crore fine by CCI
280.article_body: Google has paused its plans to enforce the Play billing system on Indian developers from October 31 following the ruling by the Competition Commission of India. CCI imposed two fines on Google, one worth ₹936.44 crore for abusing its dominant position in reference to Play Store policies and the second for ₹1,338 crore for abusing dominance in Android device market.

281.title: Stuff of dreams: Satwik after winning historic Super 750 title with Chirag
281.article_body: Reacting to becoming the first Indian doubles pair to win a Super 750 title alongside Chirag Shetty, Satwiksairaj Rankireddy took to Instagram to share, "I am thrilled beyond words and humbled beyond comparison!" "[It] is definitely the stuff of dreams! But not a moment longer to rest on our laurels, bigger goals [and] bigger titles are ahead," added Satwiksairaj.

282.title: HC bar association goes on strike over NIA seizing lawyer's phone
282.article_body: Punjab and Haryana High Court Bar Association decided to go on an indefinite strike on Monday over the National Investigation Agency (NIA) not returning the phone of a lawyer which it had seized during a raid in October. The lawyer, whose house was raided, has been representing some gangsters. The bar association had suspended work over the issue in October.

283.title: Bappi Lahiri's 'Jimmy Jimmy' being used by Chinese citizens to protest COVID lockdowns
283.article_body: Bappi Lahiri's song 'Jimmy Jimmy' is being used by Chinese citizens to protest COVID-19 lockdowns in the country. In videos that went viral, the song is sung in Mandarin as "Jie mi, jie mi", which translates to "Give me rice, give me rice". People posted the video to show how they have been deprived of essential food items during lockdowns.

284.title: Maha aarti to resume at Mumbai's Banganga after 2 years
284.article_body: The Maha aarti at Banganga in Mumbai will be started again after a gap of two years. The aarti will be held on November 7 at 7 pm. Over 1,000 diyas will be lit during the aarti which is done on the occasion of Kartik Purnima, reports said. Many dignitaries including Chief Minister Eknath Shinde are invited to the event.

285.title: India adopted zero-tolerance approach to terrorism, says President Murmu
285.article_body: While addressing Heads of Delegations of the UN Security Council’s Counter-Terrorism Committee, President Droupadi Murmu emphasised that India has adopted a zero-tolerance approach to terrorism. She said, "India has been a victim of terrorism for decades…I’m confident that the discussions during the meeting will provide good foundations for concrete action by the international community."

286.title: It's one place where you hope to feel safe: Dravid on leaked video of Kohli's hotel room
286.article_body: Reacting to video of Virat Kohli's hotel room getting leaked online, Rahul Dravid said, "[Hotel room] is one place where you feel you are away from people's prying eyes and without the media glare on you." He added, "It is one place where you hope to feel secure and safe, and that's taken away...it's not really a nice feeling."

287.title: Has he also played for India? Shahid Afridi on Amit Mishra's tweet for Babar
287.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi reacted to veteran cricketer Amit Mishra's "This too shall pass, stay strong" tweet for Pakistan captain Babar Azam amid his poor form. "Has Amit Mishra also played for India? Was he a spinner or batter?" Afridi said on TV. Notably, Babar had posted a similar tweet for Virat Kohli when the latter was battling poor form.

288.title: WB man rapes girl to get her blood for removing marriage obstacles
288.article_body: A 37-year-old man allegedly raped an eight-year-old girl in West Bengal's Bankura to get blood from her private parts believing that it'd help remove the obstacles to his marriage, police said on Monday. A tantrik told the man that his problems would be solved if he brought a cloth soaked in blood from a minor girl's private parts, police added.

289.title: No water, power supply in much of Kyiv amid Russian attacks
289.article_body: Russian cruise missile and drone strikes hit infrastructure in Ukrainian cities including Kyiv and Kharkiv on Monday, knocking out water and power supplies. Russian President Vladimir Putin said bombardment was in retaliation for an unsuccessful Ukrainian aerial and underwater drone attack on Russia's Black Sea Fleet. A Ukrainian official said the Kremlin was taking revenge for military failures.

290.title: 'Kantara' director Rishab Shetty says he won't do Hindi films
290.article_body: 'Kantara' director-actor Rishab Shetty was recently asked if he is willing to make his Bollywood debut. In response, Shetty said, "I don't do Hindi movies. I dub my Kannada movies into Hindi. I have no plans to enter Hindi cinema." Earlier, talking about his Kannada film 'Kantara', Rishab stated that the film shouldn't be remade in Hindi.

291.title: Musk changed Twitter's homepage in less than 24 hours after taking control: Report
291.article_body: Elon Musk decided to change Twitter's homepage in less than 24 hours after taking control of the company on Friday, The Verge reported. Logged out users visiting Twitter.com are now redirected to the Explore page that shows trending tweets and news stories. Earlier, people who visited Twitter's homepage while logged out of their accounts were only showed a sign-up form.

292.title: Hospital where Morbi bridge victims are admitted painted overnight for PM's visit
292.article_body: The civil hospital in Gujarat's Morbi, where victims of the suspension bridge collapse are admitted, was painted overnight for Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit on Tuesday. Over 130 people lost their lives in the bridge collapse. Reports said that new water coolers were brought in and bedsheets were changed in the two wards where the victims have been admitted.

293.title: Thane suicide victim accused 2 for cheating him of ₹17 lakh in video: Police
293.article_body: The family of a 40-year-old man who died by suicide on October 10 in Thane's Mumbra said that he had made a video before dying and said two people owed him ₹17 lakh for supplies they purchased from him. "The video mentions names of two persons," police said. He was under stress and told his family that he was cheated.

294.title: 38-yr-old Hyd engineer drowns in well while playing 'treasure hunt'
294.article_body: A 38-year-old engineer from Hyderabad, Sai Kumar, drowned in a 30-foot-deep well while playing a 'treasure hunt'. Kumar went to Hyderabad Adventure Club’s Moonlight Camping in Godhumaguda village along with his friends and colleagues on Saturday, police said. While playing, Kumar went into the well to collect one of the clues and drowned. Police registered a 'negligence' case against organisers.

295.title: Russia recruiting US-trained ex-Afghan soldiers to fight in Ukraine: Report
295.article_body: Russia is recruiting soldiers from Afghan special forces who fought alongside US troops and fled to Iran after US troop withdrawal from Afghanistan, The Associated Press reported citing former Afghan generals. Russians are reportedly offering Afghan soldiers $1,500-a-month payments and promises of safe havens. One of the generals said commandos fear being killed by Taliban if they return.

296.title: Weinstein sexually assaulted me twice in same hotel 17 yrs apart: Former actress
296.article_body: A former actress has testified that Harvey Weinstein sexually assaulted her during the Toronto International Film Festival in 1991 and then again when she went to confront him in the same hotel 17 years later. Kelly Sipherd, who was an aspiring actor in the 80-90s, said she didn't tell anyone about the second assault for years because of "sheer embarrassment".

297.title: Gangster's 6 illegal properties worth ₹20 cr demolished in Gurugram
297.article_body: Gurugram district administration and police on Monday demolished six properties worth ₹20 crore constructed over 600 square yards. The properties were built on Haryana Shehri Vikas Pradhikaran land in Sector 33 which was allegedly encroached upon by the family members of gangster Kaushal. His family members illegally grabbed it and built houses and shops, an official said.

298.title: Parts of Hyderabad likely to receive rainfall in next 3 days
298.article_body: Hyderabad is likely to receive rains in the next three days as the northeast monsoon that brings downpours to Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, and coastal Andhra Pradesh has set in over the eastern coast. Hyderabad will witness cloudy sky and haze or mist will prevail over the zone till November 4, as per India Meteorological Department (IMD) forecast.

299.title: Doesn't help even if you have Messi if I'm not there: Zlatan on Ligue 1
299.article_body: Ex-PSG player Zlatan Ibrahimović said the Ligue 1 has deteriorated since he left, adding that there is "nothing to talk about" anymore. "France needs me. I don't need France. Even if you have Kylian Mbappé, Neymar and Lionel Messi, it doesn't help you," added Ibrahimović. "Why? Because you don't have God," he stated. Ibrahimović is currently representing AC Milan.

300.title: Crowd control at site of Halloween crush was inadequate: S Korea police
300.article_body: South Korea's police chief said crowd control in the area where a crush killed more than 150 party-goers in Seoul was "inadequate". Yoon Hee-keun added that the police response was "disappointing", and he felt heavy responsibility for what happened. The incident took place on Saturday night (October 29) as crowds gathered in an alley in Itaewon to celebrate Halloween.

301.title: India's manufacturing PMI rises to 55.3 in October
301.article_body: India's manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) compiled by S&P Global, which measures manufacturing sector activity, surged to 55.3 in October from 55.1 in September. The manufacturing PMI surge indicated stronger increases in employment and stocks of purchases even as price pressures remained contained, S&P said. This is the 16th consecutive 50-plus print for the manufacturing PMI.

302.title: Babil has, what I call, the God particle: Anvitaa Dutt
302.article_body: Director Anvitaa Dutt's 'Qala' marks the acting debut of Irrfan Khan's son Babil Khan. Anvitaa said Babil had stepped into the shoes of his 'Qala' character Jagan "like they were meant for him". "Babil has, what I call, the God particle - that special something you can't explain...but can sense it every time he's in the frame," she added.

303.title: T'gana weavers send lakhs of postcards to PM Modi seeking exemption from GST
303.article_body: Weavers from across Telangana on Monday sent lakhs of postcards to PM Narendra Modi seeking the Centre's support for the handloom industry and exemption from the GST. "Narendra Modi is the first PM to apply a tax on handlooms…We [all] request [him] to allocate more budget and bring back all the schemes that were removed earlier," said MLC L Ramana.

304.title: Minorities from Afghanistan, Pak, B'desh to get citizenship in 2 Guj districts
304.article_body: Ministry of Home Affairs on Monday issued a notification empowering collectors in Gujarat's Mahesana and Anand districts to grant citizenship to minority communities from Afghanistan, Pakistan and Bangladesh. The minority communities include Hindus, Sikhs, Parsis, Christians, Buddhists and Jains. Citizenship will be granted under the Citizenship Act, 1955 and not Citizenship (Amendment) Act, 2019.

305.title: Twitter limits employee access to content moderation tools: Report
305.article_body: Twitter has limited employee access to internal tools used for content moderation, Bloomberg reported. Most employees in Twitter's Trust and Safety team are currently unable to alter or penalise accounts for violations like misleading information and hate speech, the report said. Twitter's new owner Elon Musk last week said he hadn't made "any changes to Twitter's content moderation policies" yet.

306.title: Twitter's credit rating lowered by Moody's after Musk's takeover
306.article_body: Moody's Investors Service has lowered Twitter's corporate family rating (CFR) and senior unsecured notes ratings to B1 from Ba2 following Elon Musk's acquisition of the platform. "Twitter's governance risk is highly negative reflecting Moody's expectation for aggressive financial policies and concentrated ownership by Elon Musk," Moody's said. Musk closed his acquisition of Twitter last week.

307.title: 25-year-old man loses ₹10,000 in sextortion fraud in Mumbai's Powai
307.article_body: A 25-year-old man from Mumbai's Powai area has been cheated of ₹10,000 in a sextortion fraud. The victim came across a woman on a dating app, who later on indulged in obscenity with him on a WhatsApp video call. She then threatened him to share the video on social media and asked him to pay ₹20,000 through a QR Code.

308.title: Last segment of elevated route for PCMC-Range Hill metro stretch launched
308.article_body: Pune Metro on Monday launched the last segment of the 12.064-kilometre elevated metro rail route from Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) to Range Hill station. A total of 3,934 segments were cast for the route and a total of 451 spans were constructed through these segments. The trial run will be done from Phugewadi station to Civil Court station.

309.title: 5 men gangrape 14-year-old Class 10 girl in Gurugram hotel
309.article_body: Five men allegedly gangraped a 14-year-old Class 10 girl after taking her to a hotel in Gurugram, police said. Two of the five accused have been arrested. The girl told her mother that she was taken to the hotel by her two friends on a bike where the two youths and three others allegedly raped her, the police added.

310.title: Was persuaded not to choose 'Gunjan...', but followed my gut: Janhvi
310.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor said she was persuaded not to choose 'Gunjan Saxena: The Kargil Girl', 'Good Luck Jerry' and 'Mili' as they were "unconventional choices", but she followed her gut. Stating that she's not a "calculative" actress, Janhvi added that she's happy with her career choices. Janhvi's upcoming film 'Mili' is the Hindi remake of the Malayalam film Helen (2019).

311.title: Musk tells EU Twitter will follow its content policing rules: Report
311.article_body: Elon Musk has assured EU's industry chief Thierry Breton that Twitter will abide by Europe's Digital Services Act rules on illegal online content policing, Reuters reported citing sources. Earlier, after Musk tweeted, "The bird is freed," post his Twitter acquisition, Breton quote-tweeted him saying, "In Europe, the bird will fly by our rules."

312.title: Guj CM must resign: Digvijaya Singh on Morbi bridge collapse incident
312.article_body: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh has demanded the resignation of Gujarat CM Bhupendra Patel over the Morbi bridge collapse incident. "This isn't a man-made but a government-made tragedy and the Gujarat CM must...tender his resignation. Why were so many people allowed to come on the bridge? The liability must be fixed and culprits must be arrested at the earliest," Singh added.

313.title: 'Pulp Fiction' actor Tim Roth's son Cormac Roth dies at 25 due to germ cell cancer
313.article_body: Musician Cormac Roth, the son of 'Pulp Fiction' actor Tim Roth, has died at the age of 25. The guitarist and composer had been diagnosed with stage 3 germ cell cancer in November 2021. "He was a wild and electric ball of energy and his spirit was filled with light and goodness," a statement from his family read.

314.title: 2 killed as fire breaks out at footwear factory in Delhi's Narela Industrial Area
314.article_body: At least two persons were killed as a fire broke out at a footwear factory in Delhi's Narela Industrial Area. As many as 10 fire tenders were rushed to the spot and a few people are feared trapped, Delhi Fire Service said. "A few are injured...have been shifted to hospital, all are stable and have minor injuries," Delhi Police said.

315.title: Actress Rambha, her kids injured in car accident in Canada; shares pics
315.article_body: Actress Rambha and her kids were injured in a car accident in Canada. The actress shared pictures on Instagram and wrote, "Our car was hit by another car at an intersection wayback from picking kids from school...my little Sasha is still in the hospital. Bad days bad time. Please pray for us, your prayers mean a lot."

316.title: Delhi's air quality turns 'severe'; AQI crosses 400 mark
316.article_body: The 24-hour average air quality index (AQI) in Delhi was in 'severe' category as the national capital recorded an average AQI of 426 at 9.10 am on Tuesday, according to Central Pollution Control Board's data. Meanwhile, the AQI in Gurugram was 399, while it was 397 in Noida. Some relief is expected from November 2, a senior SAFAR official said.

317.title: SC to hear PIL seeking court-monitored probe in Morbi bridge mishap on Nov 14
317.article_body: The Supreme Court has agreed to hear a PIL seeking direction to immediately appoint a judicial commission under the supervision of a retired top court judge to initiate an investigation into the Morbi bridge collapse case. The apex court will hear the PIL on November 14, news agency ANI reported. Over 130 people were killed in the incident.

318.title: Felt like my heart's been ripped out: Rio on losing 2009, 2011 CL final
318.article_body: Ex-Manchester United player Rio Ferdinand said he felt like his heart's been "ripped out" after his team's defeats in the 2009 and 2011 Champions League finals against Barcelona. "I was...as drunk as I've ever been for both...the finals...The party was crazy because you're drowning your sorrows," added Ferdinand. Discussing the 2011 Champions League, Ferdinand stated, "Barcelona...took our soul."

319.title: Imran Khan to file PKR 10 bn lawsuit against Pak Election Commission chief
319.article_body: Pakistan's former PM Imran Khan has said that he'll file a PKR 10 billion (₹373 crore) defamation lawsuit against Election Commission of Pakistan (ECP) chief, Sikandar Raja, for destroying his reputation by disqualifying him from holding public office. Khan was disqualified last month after the ECP found him guilty of unlawfully selling gifts from foreign dignitaries and heads of state.

320.title: BYJU'S served 'performance notices' to over 5,000 employees: Report
320.article_body: BYJU'S has served 'performance notices' to more than 5,000 employees across departments out of its 50,000-workforce, Moneycontrol reported. BYJU'S sales executives who failed to meet over 70% of their weekly sales target for eight weeks will be evaluated and appropriate action will be taken, the report said. BYJU'S denied the report saying there hasn't been any change in payment structure.

321.title: Amritsar petrol pump guard shoots robbers who came to loot station, kills 1
321.article_body: A guard at a petrol pump in Amritsar shot at two robbers who had allegedly come to loot the station, reports said. One of the robbers was killed. "Police reached the spot and started an investigation. CCTV footage [is] being searched," Gurmeet Singh, DSP, Amritsar, said. Reports added that the second robber ran away from the spot.

322.title: 6,997 drug smugglers arrested in last 4 months, ₹4.49 cr seized: Punjab Police
322.article_body: As many as 6,997 drug smugglers were arrested while a total of 5,346 FIRs were registered in the last four months in Punjab Police's ongoing drive against narcotics, police said. Police also recovered ₹4.49 crore of cash from the possession of drug smugglers arrested in these four months, Inspector General of Police (Headquarters) Sukhchain Singh Gill said.

323.title: How about $8: Musk as Stephen King says he'll quit Twitter if asked to pay $20 for blue tick
323.article_body: After reports claimed that Twitter may charge $20/month for blue tick badge, author Stephen King tweeted, "$20 a month to keep my blue check? F*** that, they should pay me. If that gets instituted, I'm gone like Enron." Responding to him, Elon Musk tweeted, "We need to pay the bills somehow! Twitter cannot rely entirely on advertisers. How about $8?"

324.title: Prefer not to be monster of tennis: Djokovic on record against top players
324.article_body: Discussing his impressive record against top players, Novak Djokovic said, "I prefer not to be the monster of tennis...[However]...the record against most of the top players...is positive, which is great." "I have managed to do well throughout my career," added Djokovic. Djokovic was forced to miss the Australian Open and US Open in 2022 as he is unvaccinated.

325.title: Kohli chose not to file official complaint over leaked video of his hotel room: Report
325.article_body: Virat Kohli chose not to file an official complaint with the hotel in Perth after a video of his room got leaked, Indian Express reported. As per the report, Kohli was asked by team management if he wanted to lodge complaint, but he declined. "From his point of view...the issue won’t be pursued further," a team source told Indian Express.

326.title: One kid who refuses to get out of our bed: Mira Rajput on Ishaan's birthday
326.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor's wife Mira Rajput took to Instagram to share a picture of herself, Shahid Kapoor and Ishaan Khatter to wish the latter on his birthday. "We have 2 kids that sleep in their own beds but one who refuses to get out of ours...Happy Birthday @ishaankhatter you know we love you tons," she wrote.

327.title: Over 40% consumers did not opt for power subsidy: Delhi govt
327.article_body: More than 40% of Delhi's 56.98 lakh domestic consumers have not chosen to take benefit of the government's electricity subsidies, the Delhi government officials said. The deadline to apply for subsidy ended on October 31. The officials further said that those who were not able to register will have another chance to do so during the next month's billing cycle.

328.title: Speeding car coming from wrong side hits bike in Gurugram; 1 dead
328.article_body: An 18-year-old boy was killed and his relative was seriously injured after a speeding car coming from the wrong side rammed into the motorcycle the duo was riding on in Gurugram's Sector 68, police said on Monday. The teenager had died on the spot due to bleeding, investigators said. An FIR has been filed against the car's driver.

329.title: B'luru man gets 5-year jail for celebrating Pulwama killings on Facebook
329.article_body: A special court in Bengaluru imprisoned a man, Faiz Rasheed, for five years and fined him ₹10,000 over derogatory Facebook posts about the Pulwama terrorist attack. He's a third-semester engineering student and a resident of Kacharakanahalli. He was arrested in 2019 and since then he has been lodged in prison as his bail petition was rejected.

330.title: Boy who came in contact with power cable dies in Pune; probe on
330.article_body: A probe has been launched following the death of a 14-year-old boy who came in contact with Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited's (MSEDCL) overhead power cable in Pune in October. The deceased's family conducted a protest march on Monday at an MSEDCL office and demanded action against officials responsible. Financial aid is being extended to boy's family, MSEDCL said.

331.title: Priyanka to meet Vishal Bhardwaj & Sanjay Leela Bhansali: Report
331.article_body: Priyanka Chopra will reportedly meet Sanjay Leela Bhansali and Vishal Bhardwaj during her India trip to discuss her possible Bollywood collaborations. Priyanka had previously collaborated with Sanjay for 'Bajirao Mastani', while she had featured in Vishal Bhardwaj's '7 Khoon Maaf'. Priyanka will also be seen in Farhan Akhtar's 'Jee Le Zaraa', which will also star Alia Bhatt and Katrina Kaif.

332.title: Sneak peek of how organised you're, it's inspiring: Mukti on Virat's room video
332.article_body: While commenting on the leaked video of his room shared by Virat Kohli, dancer Mukti Mohan said that it is inspiring how the video shows that Kohli is organised. "That's horrid behaviour from the well-suited educated men...You will always have our respect champ...keep shining on the field and in life," Mukti commented on Kohli's post.

333.title: I haven't seen an innings like that: Misbah on Suryakumar's 68 vs SA
333.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Misbah-ul-Haq said he "hasn't seen an innings" similar to Suryakumar Yadav's 68 off 40 balls in India's T20 World Cup 2022 match against South Africa. "He's the best middle-order batter in T20 cricket...It seemed as if he knew where the ball would land and where he can hit it," added Misbah. Suryakumar smashed three sixes during his knock.

334.title: BMC announces 10% water cut in Mumbai for 10 days
334.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation announced on Monday that there will be a 10% water cut in Mumbai Metropolitan region, Thane and Bhiwandi Municipal Corporations from November 1 to 10 due to urgent repair work. "All citizens are requested to use water judiciously. Citizens' co-operation to Municipal Administration during this period is requested," the BMC said.

335.title: 'Scary' sound of Earth's magnetic field released by space agency
335.article_body: The European Space Agency (ESA) has released an audio which reveals how the Earth's magnetic field sounds like. "We are celebrating [Halloween] by listening to the scary sound of Earth’s magnetic field," ESA wrote. "Scientists at the Technical University of Denmark have taken magnetic signals measured by ESA's Swarm satellite mission and converted them into sound," it added.

336.title: We'll thrive again, not having any takeover discussions: Credit Suisse Chairman
336.article_body: Credit Suisse Chairman Axel Lehmann during an interview said, "We are going to thrive again, so we don’t have any takeover discussions." He added, "We want to stay independent." Notably, the company's share price has declined by more than half this year and it is also starting initial headcount reductions of 2,700 positions in the fourth quarter.

337.title: Axis Bank stock falls by over 2% after 1.3% stake sold via block deals
337.article_body: Shares of Axis Bank declined by over 2% on Tuesday after 4.1 crore shares or 1.3% equity worth ₹3,654 crore changed hands at an average of ₹894/piece. A US-based private investment company Bain Capital was reportedly looking to sell its 1.24% stake in the lender via block deals. At 10:10 am, Axis Bank's stock was trading 2.24% lower on NSE.

338.title: Village head, wife and mother shot dead while asleep in UP's Budaun
338.article_body: A 58-year-old village head, his 54-year-old wife and his 80-year-old mother were shot dead by unidentified assailants at their residence in Satra village in Uttar Pradesh's Budaun on Monday, police said. The victims were asleep at the time of the incident, police added. "During interrogation, it was found that there was enmity between family members," SSP Budaun OP Singh said.

339.title: 24-year-old Indian businessman shot dead by policeman in Uganda: Reports
339.article_body: A 24-year-old Indian businessman identified as Kuntaj Patel was shot dead by a policeman in Uganda, according to local reports. Patel's employee reportedly said that he and his boss were attending a client when the policeman entered their shop, aimed the gun at Patel and shot him in the chest. The accused has reportedly been charged with murder.

340.title: No objectification of woman, her body parts: Kangana on Madhubala's 'Aaiye...'
340.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut said that Madhubala's 'Aaiye Meharban' has "no objectification of woman and her body parts". "Sensuality and seduction [have] nothing to do with vulgarity and raunchy item numbers...this song has everything," she added. She wrote this as she shared a video clip of the song on her Instagram Stories.

341.title: Rahul is under a lot of pressure, he has gone into a shell: Uthappa
341.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Robin Uthappa said KL Rahul is under a "lot of pressure" having scored 22 runs so far in the three matches played till now by Team India in the T20 World Cup 2022. "It seems as if he has gone into a shell...Rahul's mind is clouded," added Uthappa. "I feel they should continue backing Rahul," he stated.

342.title: Depressed woman kills her children, attempts suicide in Navi Mumbai
342.article_body: A 32-year-old woman allegedly killed her two children and attempted suicide on Sunday evening in Navi Mumbai's Ghansoli village. Before taking the step, she had informed her husband that she was feeling depressed and experiencing extreme mood swings. Her husband used to sell ice-cream on a hand cart and had a loan to pay back.

343.title: Price of commercial 19-kg LPG cylinder cut by ₹115.50
343.article_body: The price of commercial liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) cylinders was cut by ₹115.50 on Tuesday. A 19-kg commercial LPG cylinder will now cost ₹1,744 in Delhi. However, the price of the 14.2 kg domestic LPG cylinder has been kept unchanged. A 19-kg commercial LPG cylinder will now cost ₹1,846 in Kolkata, ₹1,696 in Mumbai and ₹1,893 in Chennai.

344.title: Brazilian truckers block roads in protest of Bolsonaro’s election defeat
344.article_body: Truckers in Brazil protested the defeat of outgoing President Jair Bolsonaro on Monday by blocking roads in 20 states. Video footage showed some truckers at roadblocks calling for a military coup to prevent Lula da Silva from becoming the President. Lula, who'll become the President for the third time, won 50.9% of the votes compared with 49.1% for Bolsonaro.

345.title: West Bengal girl kills self as video of her stealing chocolates goes viral
345.article_body: A third-year undergraduate student died by suicide in West Bengal after a video of her stealing chocolates from a store in a shopping mall went viral. Her father said that she paid the price of the chocolates and also apologised to the store authorities. However, people at the store made a video of the whole incident and posted it online.

346.title: Halt 'useless' joint military drills with S Korea: North Korea to US
346.article_body: North Korea has demanded that US and South Korea stop large-scale military exercises in the region, calling them a "provocation". "If...US doesn't want any serious developments not suited to its security interests, it should stop the useless and ineffective war exercises at once. If not, it'll have to...take the blame for all...consequences," North Korea said. The drills began on Monday.

347.title: Fire breaks out at building that houses ex-cricketer Zaheer Khan's restaurant in Pune
347.article_body: A massive fire broke out at a building in Maharashtra's Pune on Tuesday morning. The top floor of the Marvel Vista building located at the city's Lulla Nagar Chowk caught fire. The building houses a restaurant owned by former India cricketer Zaheer Khan on the ground floor. No casualties or injuries have been reported so far.

348.title: Janhvi insisted we shoot in freezer with -8 to -12°C temperature: Boney on Mili
348.article_body: Film producer Boney Kapoor said that his daughter and actress Janhvi Kapoor is an enthusiastic actor. While speaking about the film 'Mili', he said, "She [Janhvi] insisted on shooting in an actual freezer where the temperature was...minus 8 to minus 12 degrees Celsius. In the second half of the film...it is only through her expressions that everything is conveyed."

349.title: Hyderabad Police mandates Anti-Drug Committees in all colleges
349.article_body: In a bid to spread awareness against the possession, consumption and sale of narcotic drugs and psychotropic substances, Hyderabad Police has mandated the setting up of an Anti-Drug Committee (ADC) in all city colleges and similar institutions.
