Commissioner of Police CV Anand said that police have now adopted a strategic move to insulate increasingly vulnerable youngsters in colleges.

350.title: Kyiv mayor urges EU leaders to maintain political, economic aid to Ukraine
350.article_body: During an interview with DW, mayor of Kyiv, Vitali Klitschko, urged European Union leaders to maintain political and economic aid to Ukraine. "Please stay with Ukraine...we are fighting and defending not just our homes and our country. We are defending every one of you in Europe", Klitschko said. He warned that Russian President Vladimir Putin won't stop at invading Ukraine.

351.title: Omar claims Ladakh authorities tried to stop him from visiting Kargil
351.article_body: National Conference leader Omar Abdullah has claimed that authorities in Ladakh tried to dissuade him from visiting Kargil and told him "not to come here". "There (Eastern Ladakh) China has come...you couldn't stop them...We are only going from Srinagar to Kargil via Drass," he said. He also alleged that he wasn't allowed to use a public address system in Drass.

352.title: Himachal Pradesh BJP expels 5 of its rebel leaders for 6 years
352.article_body: Himachal Pradesh BJP expelled five of its rebel leaders, including BJP state vice-president Kripal Parmar, from primary membership for six years. The others include former Kinnaur MLA, Tejwant Negi, former Anni MLA, Kishori Lal, former Indora MLA, Manohar Dhiman and former Nalagarh MLA, KL Thakur. They were indulging in anti-party activities, BJP state president Suresh Kashyap said.

353.title: Incredibly disappointed by gross invasion of privacy: ICC on leaked video of Kohli's hotel room
353.article_body: Reacting to the leaked video of Virat Kohli's hotel room in Perth, ICC said, "We're incredibly disappointed by the gross invasion of privacy suffered by a member of...Indian travelling party at Crown Perth." It added, "We continue to work with event hotels and security providers to ensure...this remains an isolated incident and player privacy is fully respected at all times."

354.title: Morbi bridge renovated by administration, no role of Guj govt: Ex-Dy CM
354.article_body: Following the Morbi bridge collapse incident, ex-Gujarat Deputy CM Nitin Patel said renovation and opening of the bridge were done by Morbi administration and the Gujarat government didn't have any role in it, direct or indirect. "Oreva is an old company for repairing watches...only Morbi municipality knows on which qualification it handed over the work of bridge renovation," Patel added.

355.title: Saudi Prince Alwaleed, Jack Dorsey among top investors in Twitter after Musk takeover
355.article_body:
As Elon Musk took over Twitter, regulatory filings revealed a list of top investors in the company. 
Saudi Arabia's Kingdom Holding Company, along with the private office of Prince Alwaleed bin Talal moved almost 35 million Twitter shares worth about $1.9 billion to become the "second-largest" investor in the new parent company. Jack Dorsey moved over 18 million shares.

356.title: Speeding car rams into Warkari procession in Maharashtra; 7 killed
356.article_body: Seven people were killed and several others injured after a speeding car rammed into a procession of Warkaris (pilgrims) in Maharashtra's Solapur on Monday, police said. The accident apparently occurred after car's 75-year-old driver lost control, according to police. State CM Eknath Shinde expressed grief over the incident and announced a ₹5 lakh ex-gratia for each of the deceased's families.

357.title: Aviation turbine fuel price hiked by 4.3% to ₹1.2 lakh/kl in Delhi
357.article_body: Price of aviation turbine fuel (ATF) was increased by 4.3% to ₹1.2 lakh/kilolitre from ₹1.1 lakh/kilolitre in Delhi on Tuesday. On October 1, ATF price was slashed by ₹5,521.17/kilolitre to ₹1.15 lakh/kilolitre. The price of a 19-kg commercial LPG cylinder was also reduced by ₹115 in Delhi with effect from Tuesday. A 19-kg cylinder will now cost ₹1,744 in Delhi.

358.title: Taylor becomes 1st artist to claim top 10 slots of Billboard Hot 100 chart
358.article_body: Taylor Swift has become the first artist in history to claim Billboard Hot 100 chart's top 10 slots for a week with her new album 'Midnights'. Taylor has surpassed Drake, who had held the previous record with nine of the top 10 songs for a week in September 2021. "I'm in shambles," Taylor tweeted in reaction to the news.

359.title: What can I say: Ayushmann as friend reminds Tahira of wrong anniversary date
359.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana reacted after his wife Tahira Kashyap forgot their wedding anniversary date and posted a picture to wish him one day before the anniversary. Tahira said that she was reminded by a friend that she got the anniversary date wrong. "What can I say now? Happy anniversary in advance," Ayushmann wrote.

360.title: Actress Sonali Chakraborty passes away aged 59 in Kolkata
360.article_body: Bengali actress Sonali Chakraborty passed away at a private hospital in Kolkata aged 59 on Monday following a prolonged illness. Chakraborty was suffering from liver complications and was undergoing treatment at the hospital for months. She is survived by her actor-husband Shankar Chakraborty and their daughter.

361.title: 29-yr-old Delhi man frustrated over breakup shoots ex-girlfriend to death
361.article_body: A 29-year-old man killed his former girlfriend as he was allegedly frustrated over their breakup in Delhi, reports said. The accused was hiding in different hotels to escape arrest. Police said that there was no CCTV footage available for the incident and the arrest was made based on technical surveillance. Gunshot wounds were found on the woman's body.

362.title: Zomato restores woman's review on B'luru eatery over food poisoning, CEO thanks her
362.article_body: Zomato has reinstated the negative review made by a woman who claimed she and her colleague suffered severe food poisoning after eating at a Bengaluru restaurant. The review was removed on grounds of mentioning health code violations, Zomato earlier said. "We have removed this policy with immediate effect...Thank you for...influencing positive change," Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal told the woman.

363.title: Social media sites should proactively flag fake news: CEC Rajiv Kumar
363.article_body: The election management bodies expect social media sites to use their "algorithm power" to proactively flag fake news, Chief Election Commissioner (CEC) Rajiv Kumar said. Kumar said that social media platforms proclaim to have content policies but added that they do also have the "algorithm power" and a proactive approach to countering fake news would facilitate "credible electoral outcomes".

364.title: Trump's real estate firm cheated tax authorities for 15 years: Prosecutor
364.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump's real estate company cheated tax authorities for 15 years, prosecutor Susan Hoffinger said during a criminal tax fraud trial. Hoffinger added that the company paid certain executives, including former CFO Allen Weisselberg, in perks like rent and cars without disclosing it to tax authorities. If convicted, the Trump Organisation could face $1.6 million in fines.

365.title: iPhone output could fall by 30% at China plant amid COVID-19 curbs: Report
365.article_body: Apple iPhones' production could fall by nearly 30% at one of the world's biggest iPhone plants in China due to tightening of COVID-19 curbs in the country, Reuters quoted a source as saying. Several videos, circulated on social media, showed workers escaping from the Zhengzhou plant. Meanwhile, Foxconn is working to increase production at Shenzhen factory to meet the shortfall.

366.title: Twitter should repair the damage done to Trump: Mexican Prez
366.article_body: Mexican President Andrés Manuel López Obrador on Monday urged the new owner of Twitter, Elon Musk, to "repair the damage done by the cancellation of [former US] President [Donald] Trump's account". Obrador also urged Musk to free the social media platform from what he described as "conservative control". Trump was banned from Twitter after the 2021 US Capitol riots.

367.title: Hyderabad to get multipurpose sports complex in Banjara Hills
367.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has taken up the construction of a multipurpose indoor sports complex in Banjara Hills at an estimated cost of ₹6 crore. The one lakh square feet complex will have a cricket box, kabaddi court, badminton and tennis courts. It will also have gyms and a place for yoga along with carrom and chess games.

368.title: 2 die, 4 admitted to hospital after consuming illicit liquor in Pune
368.article_body: At least two members of a family, aged 35 and 40, died after allegedly consuming illicit liquor at Malegaon in Pune's Baramati on Sunday, police said. Notably, four more people from the same family who had also consumed the same liquor were admitted to a hospital. "We have booked three people in this case," police added.

369.title: ₹69.95 crore-heroin hidden in trolley bag seized at Delhi airport
369.article_body: The Air Customs at IGI Airport in Delhi has seized heroin worth ₹69.95 crore which was hidden in the false bottom and the top of a trolley bag, the Customs department said on Monday. A Belizean national who was carrying the trolley bag was arrested under the NDPS Act. The accused had arrived in Delhi from Johannesburg via Doha.

370.title: Get all hanging bridges in K'taka evaluated: Cong leader after Morbi mishap
370.article_body: After more than 130 people lost their lives in the Morbi bridge collapse, Karnataka Congress spokesperson Nivedith Alva has urged the Karnataka administration to get steel hanging bridges evaluated urgently. "I would urge the state administration to...ensure that basic maintenance is being carried out. This is required...especially in coastal areas that see very heavy rain," he wrote on Twitter.

371.title: B'luru's Namma Metro launches QR code-based ticketing system on WhatsApp
371.article_body: Bengaluru's Namma Metro in partnership with WhatsApp launched a chatbot-based QR ticketing service enabling users to ride the metro without using tokens or smart cards. The chatbot is integrated with Unified Payments Interface (UPI) powered payments on WhatsApp. To use the service, commuters need to send 'Hi' to BMRCL's official WhatsApp chatbot number 9181055 56677.

372.title: Man being extorted & threatened by 2 women, kills self in Pune
372.article_body: A 34-year-old man allegedly died by suicide at his house in Pune's Pimpri-Chinchwad, police said. According to a suicide note, which was found in the deceased's pocket, two women "extorted money and gold jewellery from the victim and threatened to share photographs of their physical relationship with his wife", a senior inspector said. The incident occurred on Saturday, police added.

373.title: 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz receives world number one trophy, shares pics
373.article_body: Spain's 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz received his world number one trophy in Paris on Monday evening. Sharing pictures on Instagram, Alcaraz wrote, "A special day! Today I received the world number one trophy in Paris! I should find somewhere to put it, no?" Alcaraz became the youngest men's world number one in tennis history in September this year.

374.title: What others see as 'layoff', I only see as time off: BYJU's CEO on rehiring fired staff
374.article_body: BYJU’s CEO Byju Raveendran sent an email to his employees after the recent layoffs at the company. On rehiring the laid-off employees, Byju wrote, "What others see as 'layoff', I only see as time off. Bringing you back...will now be...number one priority for me." He added that HR has been instructed to make new roles available to affected employees.

375.title: Think about your team instead of yourself: Gambhir on Babar Azam
375.article_body: Discussing Babar Azam's captaincy during Pakistan's T20 World Cup 2022 match against Netherlands, Gautam Gambhir said, "[He] should've sent Fakhar Zaman up the...order." "This is called selfishness...It's easy for Babar and Muhammad Rizwan to open the innings...and create...records," added Gambhir. "If you want to be a leader, you've to think about your team [instead of yourself]," he stated.

376.title: 16-yr-old Mumbai girl looking for hide-&-seek playmates hit by lift, dies
376.article_body: A 16-year-old girl was killed after she stuck her head into the square opening of the lift door while looking for her playmates during a game of hide-and-seek in Mumbai's Mankhurd. Reports said that the lift descended and hit the girl on her head. The lift had reportedly been made operational five days ago.

377.title: We tried to hurry Bumrah back and look what happened: Chief selector Chetan Sharma
377.article_body: While announcing India squads for New Zealand and Bangladesh tours, BCCI chief selector Chetan Sharma said that it is important to look into players' workload management. "We tried to hurry Jasprit Bumrah back into Team India squad and look what happened. We are without him in T20 World Cup," he added. "NCA team is looking after him well," Sharma said.

378.title: We stand with India: US as Morbi bridge collapse claims over 130 lives
378.article_body: After a suspension bridge collapse in Gujarat's Morbi claimed over 130 lives, US President Joe Biden expressed his condolences and tweeted, "In this difficult hour, we will continue to stand with and support the Indian people." "We stand with the people of India who are mourning the victims of the devastating bridge collapse in Gujarat," US Vice-President Kamala Harris tweeted.

379.title: Still fighting perception that I'm entitled & untalented: Janhvi
379.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor said that she's still fighting some people's perception that she's "privileged, entitled and untalented". "I am a hard-working girl who has something to offer. I am fighting to prove that to myself and other people," she added. Janhvi further added that she's learnt from her late mother Sridevi about how to survive in the film industry.

380.title: 53-year-old man stabbed to death while resisting robbery bid in Delhi
380.article_body: A 53-year-old man was allegedly stabbed to death on Sunday by two unidentified persons while resisting a robbery bid near the Narela Railway Station in Delhi, police said on Monday. The incident occurred when the deceased, a resident of Haryana's Sonipat, was going to the station to board a train. The accused tried to take away his bag, police added.

381.title: Strikes on Ukraine power grid in response to Crimea attack: Putin
381.article_body: Russian strikes on Ukrainian power grid and a decision to freeze participation in a Black Sea grain export programme were responses to a drone attack on Moscow's fleet in Crimea on Saturday, Russian President Vladimir Putin said. Ukrainian drones had used the same marine passages that grain ships transited under the UN-brokered deal, Putin added. Ukraine has denied the allegations.

382.title: Schools, colleges shut in 3 districts in Tamil Nadu on Tuesday amid heavy rainfall alert
382.article_body: The schools and colleges in Tamil Nadu's Nagapattinam, Tiruvarur and Mayiladuthurai districts will remain closed on Tuesday in the wake of a heavy rainfall alert by India Meteorological Department (IMD). The northeast monsoon season arrived on October 29 in southern India, following which several areas of Tamil Nadu have been witnessing heavy rainfall and thunderstorms.

383.title: Actors Manjima Mohan, Gautham Karthik confirm relationship; share pics
383.article_body: Actors Manjima Mohan and Gautham Karthik have confirmed their relationship and shared pictures on Instagram. "Three years ago when I was completely lost you came into my life like a guardian angel," Manjima wrote. "I've a peace in my heart now that I've never felt before, and that's all because of what you have nourished in my life," Gautham wrote.

384.title: Musk dissolves Twitter's entire board to become sole director, says 'This is temporary'
384.article_body: A securities filing has revealed that Elon Musk dissolved Twitter's board of directors to become the sole director of the company. According to the filing, Bret Taylor, Parag Agrawal, Omid Kordestani, David Rosenblatt, Martha Lane Fox, Patrick Pichette, Egon Durban, Fei-Fei Li and Mimi Alemayehou are no longer directors of Twitter. Musk also tweeted that this move "is just temporary".

385.title: We used to give away tickets, people sold them for ₹10 to buy booze: Rishab
385.article_body: Actor Rishab Shetty recalled that he and actor Rakshit Shetty used to give away tickets for their films to people outside theatres. "But those people would sell the tickets for ₹10 to buy booze. That was also a time we faced. But now, our work is being appreciated by people and everyone is supporting," the actor-director added.

386.title: Mumbai driver records drunken confession of employer's affairs, blackmails him
386.article_body: The Mumbai Police are on lookout for a driver who secretly recorded drunken 'confession' of his employer about his alleged illicit relationship with daughters of his live-in partner. The driver blackmailed both employer and his live-in-partner to send the recording to the daughters' husbands and extorted ₹10.70 lakh from them. The live-in partner filed a complaint after the blackmail continued.

387.title: 'Steel Man of India' Jamshed J Irani passes away aged 86
387.article_body: Dr Jamshed J Irani, widely known as the 'Steel Man of India', passed away at the age of 86 in Jamshedpur late Monday night, Tata Steel confirmed. Irani joined Tata Steel in 1968 and retired after spending 43 years at the company in 2011. The Padma Bhushan awardee served as the Managing Director of Tata Steel from 1992 to 2001.

388.title: Elon Musk to serve as Twitter CEO
388.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk will serve as the CEO of Twitter, according to a regulatory filing on Monday. This will be in addition to Musk running Tesla, SpaceX, Neuralink and The Boring Company. In a separate filing, it was revealed that Musk has dissolved Twitter's board, becoming its sole director after acquiring the company on Friday.

389.title: Instagram fixes bug that suspended multiple accounts, cut follower count
389.article_body: Instagram on Monday said it has fixed a bug that prevented people across different parts of the world from accessing their accounts and "caused a temporary change for some in number of followers". The outage reportedly lasted for about eight hours. Many users had complained about receiving messages that said their accounts were suspended.

390.title: Gautam Adani becomes world's 3rd richest person with $132 billion wealth: Forbes
390.article_body: Gautam Adani on Monday reclaimed his position as the world's third-richest person with $131.9 billion wealth. The 60-year-old industrialist overtook Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos on Forbes' Real-Time Billionaires List after adding $314 million to his net worth. Elon Musk is currently the world's richest person with $223.8 billion fortune, followed by Bernard Arnault with a net worth of $156.5 billion.

391.title: Passenger gets India-SA score update on tissue paper from pilot onboard flight, shares pic
391.article_body: A Team India fan shared a picture of a handwritten India-South Africa T20 World Cup 2022 match score update given to him by a pilot on a tissue paper onboard an IndiGo flight. "India lost today...but IndiGo ⁦won my heart. Pilot sent...note mid-air when requested for score update," he tweeted. "We're glad to see this," IndiGo responded to his tweet.

392.title: US Prez got angry in June phone call with Zelenskyy, said 'show gratitude': Report
392.article_body: US President Joe Biden raised his voice at Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy during a phone call in June, NBC News reported. Biden had reportedly just finished telling Zelenskyy about America's new $1 billion military aid when the latter started listing additional help needed by Ukraine. Biden became angry and said Zelenskyy "could show a little more gratitude", the report added.

393.title: Hope you are watching everything, Sai Baba: Prithvi Shaw after Team India snub
393.article_body: In an apparent reaction to him not being selected in Team India squads for New Zealand and Bangladesh tours, Prithvi Shaw shared a picture of Sai Baba on Instagram Stories. He wrote, "Hope you are watching everything, Sai Baba." The 22-year-old batter last played for India in July 2021.

394.title: 19-year-old Dewald Brevis smashes fastest 150 in T20 cricket history
394.article_body: Titans batting all-rounder Dewald Brevis on Monday smashed the fastest 150 in the history of T20 cricket. The 19-year-old South African crossed the 150-run mark off 52 deliveries against Knights in a CSA T20 Challenge match to break the record previously held by Chris Gayle (53 deliveries). Brevis, who is known as Baby AB, scored 162(57) in the match.

395.title: Will do films my heart says yes to, not for any other reason: Rajkummar
395.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao in an interview said, "I'm just going to do films I believe in, that my heart says yes to and not for any other reason." The actor will next be seen in 'Monica O My Darling', a neo-noir crime comedy directed by Vasan Bala. Rajkummar is also set to star in 'Guns & Gulaabs' and 'Bheed'.

396.title: Some couldn't come, we couldn't invite some: Ali as he shares pics from reception
396.article_body: Ali Fazal, taking to Instagram, shared a video featuring pictures from his wedding reception which took place in the first week of October. In the pictures, Ali and his actress-wife Richa Chadha were seen posing with Hrithik Roshan, Tabu and others. "I want to thank everyone...Some couldn't come, we were unable to invite some...but our love is...with you," Ali wrote.

397.title: Tamil Nadu logs 152 COVID-19 cases in 24 hrs; active cases decline
397.article_body: Tamil Nadu reported 152 fresh cases of COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, taking the state's total case tally to 35,92,043, the state health department informed on Monday. No deaths due to the infection were recorded. Tamil Nadu's active case count fell from 1,732 on Sunday to 1,602 on Monday, according to the daily COVID-19 bulletin.

398.title: Norway raises military alert level in response to Ukraine war
398.article_body: Norwegian PM Jonas Gahr Store on Monday announced that his country's military would be put on a higher level of alertness from Tuesday in response to the war in Ukraine. "There are no indications that Russia is expanding its warfare to other countries, but the increased tensions make us more exposed to threats, intelligence operations and influence campaigns," Store added.

399.title: We didn't get the start with bat: Ireland captain Balbirnie on loss vs Aus
399.article_body: Ireland captain Andy Balbirnie said his side didn't get the start with the bat in their T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match against Australia. "But to show the fight at the end was nice. Looking at the scoreboard we thought it wasn't against us," he added. Chasing 180, Ireland were bowled out for 137 in 18.1 overs.

400.title: It wasn't the easiest wicket: Finch after scoring 63(44)
400.article_body: After scoring 63(44) and winning the 'Player of the Match' award, Australian skipper Aaron Finch said that it wasn't the easiest wicket to bat at the Gabba. "It was a lot slower than what we expected. They (Ireland) changed their pace really well and bowled a lot of cutters...it was hard to get a rhythm," Finch said.

401.title: Who knows if someone had stayed with Tucker: Balbirnie after losing to Aus
401.article_body: After losing to Australia by 42 runs, Ireland skipper Andy Balbirnie said the match was hardly fought. "Looking at the scoreboard we thought it wasn't against us, again the wickets column was a problem and who knows if someone had stayed with [Lorcan] Tucker," Balbirnie said. Notably, Tucker scored 71*(48) against Australia at Gabba on Monday.

402.title: Not here to be liked, having a great time with my team: Verstappen
402.article_body: F1 world champion Max Verstappen said abuse from Lewis Hamilton fans does not bother him. "I am not here to be liked, and it's not going to ruin my day. I am having a great time with my team," said Verstappen. He added that the abuse could be due to "frustration" as Hamilton "is not doing so well" this year.

403.title: Need to convert more chances: Ind hockey skipper Harmanpreet
403.article_body: After being beaten for the first time in the ongoing FIH Hockey Pro League, Indian hockey skipper Harmanpreet Singh said that the team needs to "convert more chances" into goals. "We were trying for different variations and combinations. But sometimes, they do not work out," Harmanpreet said. Notably, India lost to Spain by 2-3 in Bhubaneswar on Sunday.
